revisions:
[{'created': '2012-04-20 18:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add tracking of service tasks

Partially implements blueprint deployability-improvements

Previously, what threads and tasks were running in a service was a black
box. It wasn't clear what was happening. This change registers most
threads as a "task" which exposes a unique id (for future use), a
description of what it is doing, as well as if it's a daemon thread
(for future use).

Change-Id: Ieac774feb3d47413bb06bf193c67b7623fab7b46
'}, {'created': '2012-04-20 22:42:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add tracking of service tasks

Partially implements blueprint deployability-improvements

Services don't explicitly track what tasks it is performing at any time.
This can make troubleshooting more difficult, but also leads to
situations where there is no easy way to wait for services to finish
currently running tasks before stopping.

This change registers most threads as a "task" along with a unique
id (for future use), a start time, a description of what it is doing
and a flag denoting if it's a daemon thread (always running).

When a SIGTERM or SIGINT signal is received, the service will wait
until all non-daemon threads are finished executing before exiting.

Change-Id: Ieac774feb3d47413bb06bf193c67b7623fab7b46
'}, {'created': '2012-05-02 16:37:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add tracking of RPC tasks

Partially implements blueprint deployability-improvements

Services don't explicitly track what tasks it is performing at any time.
This can make troubleshooting more difficult, but also leads to
situations where there is no easy way to wait for services to finish
currently running tasks before stopping.

This change registers RPC worker threads as a "task" along with a unique
id, a start time and a description of what it is doing.

When a SIGTERM or SIGINT signal is received, the service will wait
until all tasks are finished executing before exiting.

Change-Id: Ieac774feb3d47413bb06bf193c67b7623fab7b46
'}]
commit_message:
Add tracking of RPC tasks

Partially implements blueprint deployability-improvements

Services don't explicitly track what tasks it is performing at any time.
This can make troubleshooting more difficult, but also leads to
situations where there is no easy way to wait for services to finish
currently running tasks before stopping.

This change registers RPC worker threads as a "task" along with a unique
id, a start time and a description of what it is doing.

When a SIGTERM or SIGINT signal is received, the service will wait
until all tasks are finished executing before exiting.

Change-Id: Ieac774feb3d47413bb06bf193c67b7623fab7b46

commit_message:
Fixed error in retrieving the project details even it got deleted

Description: nova-manage project quota <project_name> this command
            will display the resources which are allocated by nova.
            Previouly i made changes it display's resoures which are
            not exosted in the database.i made some changes in
            nova-manage file while calling quota method.Nova hard coded
            some resources to every project irrespective of database.
            nova everytime retrievs the value from quota.py file so i
            made changes according to project existance.

Fixed BUG 888229

Change-Id: I065f87bed01e9ec3cb91ab3eeb20bbf8a004c45c

subject: Use tox for running tests locally.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-02 11:37:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

Thanks for ensuring that the glance-specific logcapture continues to work.

A change is needed to tox.ini to ensure we can still run an individual tests easily (see inline comment on tox.ini).

Also couple of whitespace-related nit-picks in inline comments.

The new tools/with_env.sh script isn't exactly equivalent to what went before, which allowed arbitrary commands to be run with the venv - now only commands installed in .tox/venv/bin are runnable AFAICS. Not necessarily a big issue though.

On the subject of equivalence, it might be worth adding a unittests-only env to the tox.ini, as an equivalent to:

  $ ./run_tests.sh --unittests-only

for example:

  tox.ini
  ...
  + [testenv:unittests-only]
  + commands = python run_tests.py --exclude-dir=glance/tests/functional

One last observation (and I don't know if there is any good way around this), but tox seems sub-optimal when it comes to matching and reusing pre-existing virtual envs. For example running the tests will create a new venv, then running a command via with_venv.sh will needlessly fire up another new venv, re-installing all the pip-requires which is very slow. 

Even within the original test run, IIUC the pep8 phase creates a new venv which is obviously unnecessary.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-05-02 20:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi!

Great feedback - I'll go work on the a lot of that.

A couple of notes on re-use and with_venv (although I think I've just thought of a nice way to deal with your concern)

The "venv" tox environment is set up to allow for running arbitrary commands. So doing with_venv without that script would look like this:

tox -evenv -- some random command

But you're right about the fact that you wind up with three rather than one venvs.

Two things for that (not related)

a) If you don't already, you should set PIP_DOWNLOAD_CACHE to something so that you're not re-downloading things.

BUT

b) I think what we might want to do actually is to make run_tests.sh just call the tests using the venv env, and we can leave the separate venvs for jenkins or if people want to use tox directly... lemme poke at that real quick.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-05-02 22:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-02 01:29:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use tox for running tests locally.

See: http://wiki.openstack.org/ProjectTestingInterface

Tox can manage virtualenvs, and is currently doing so for running
tests in Jenkins.  It's just as, or more, useful for running tests
locally, so this starts the migration from the run_tests system to
tox.  The goal is to reduce duplicate testing infrastructure, and
get what's running locally on developer workstations as close to
what is run by Jenkins as possible.

This patch removes run_tests.py, and the scripts that manage .venv.
It makes run_tests.sh call tox to facilitate the transition for
developers used to typing "run_tests.sh".

Developers will need tox installed on their workstations.  It can
be installed from PyPI with "pip install tox".  run_tests.sh outputs
those instructions if tox is not present.

New facilities are available using tox directly, including:

  tox -e py26  # run tests under python 2.6
  tox -e py27  # run tests under python 2.7
  tox -e pep8  # run pep8 tests
  tox          # run all of the above
  tox -e venv foo  # run the command "foo" inside a virtualenv

The configuration of the openstack nose plugin is removed from
setup.cfg and added to the nosetests command line arguments in tox.
It is used when running tox from the command line, so the enhanced,
colorized output is visible to developers running the test suite
locally.  However, when Jenkins runs tox, the xunit plugin will be
used instead, providing output natively understood by jenkins which
is much more readable in that context.

As a temporary conceit for glance, run_tests.py is being kept in a
much reduced form to enable the in-tree nosetests plugin. As soon
as we can figure out a good way to do the logcapture (perhaps using
the standard logcapture plugin and using the logging module slightly
differently?) we should remove run_tests.py and change tox.ini to
just call nosetests.

Change-Id: Ief90e8bbad55d9be0cf567fc08264ebd0aa4366b

commit_message:
Use tox for running tests locally.

See: http://wiki.openstack.org/ProjectTestingInterface

Tox can manage virtualenvs, and is currently doing so for running
tests in Jenkins.  It's just as, or more, useful for running tests
locally, so this starts the migration from the run_tests system to
tox.  The goal is to reduce duplicate testing infrastructure, and
get what's running locally on developer workstations as close to
what is run by Jenkins as possible.

This patch removes run_tests.py, and the scripts that manage .venv.
It makes run_tests.sh call tox to facilitate the transition for
developers used to typing "run_tests.sh".

Developers will need tox installed on their workstations.  It can
be installed from PyPI with "pip install tox".  run_tests.sh outputs
those instructions if tox is not present.

New facilities are available using tox directly, including:

  tox -e py26  # run tests under python 2.6
  tox -e py27  # run tests under python 2.7
  tox -e pep8  # run pep8 tests
  tox          # run all of the above
  tox -e venv foo  # run the command "foo" inside a virtualenv

The configuration of the openstack nose plugin is removed from
setup.cfg and added to the nosetests command line arguments in tox.
It is used when running tox from the command line, so the enhanced,
colorized output is visible to developers running the test suite
locally.  However, when Jenkins runs tox, the xunit plugin will be
used instead, providing output natively understood by jenkins which
is much more readable in that context.

As a temporary conceit for glance, run_tests.py is being kept in a
much reduced form to enable the in-tree nosetests plugin. As soon
as we can figure out a good way to do the logcapture (perhaps using
the standard logcapture plugin and using the logging module slightly
differently?) we should remove run_tests.py and change tox.ini to
just call nosetests.

Change-Id: Ief90e8bbad55d9be0cf567fc08264ebd0aa4366b

commit_message:
bug 948242 make doc use 'Administration' consistently

Changes the title and reference to titles of documents previously called
 "Admin Guide/Manual" to be "Administration Guide/Manual", as suggested in
bug 948242

Patched to get the Quantum Administrator Manual title to wrap correctly in PDF output.

Change-Id: I360d74c5ad16650c7b838541bb976680c0297b26

subject: scheduler_default_filters to scheduler_filters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 191, 'name': 'Trey Morris', 'email': 'trey.morris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tr3buchet'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-17 17:55:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Won't this break existing configurations that use this option?  How about still supporting the old option in the code for backwards compatibility?"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-17 18:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, this will break existing configurations that use this option, but its a tiny change (with updated documentation).  And there is a precedent for changing nova.conf files between versions (you now cannot use the --flag format in folsom anyway).

If you like, I can put a comment in the documentation saying this flag was renamed from scheduler_default_filters.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-17 18:36:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I guess we'll see what others think.  I'm just not in favor of breaking existing configs if it's not necessary.

Maybe we could add something to openstack.common.cfg to make adding option aliases really easy to add."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-17 20:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Adding something to openstack.common.cfg to make option aliases really easy sounds like the a good solution to me.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-17 20:37:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I added Mark McLoughlin to the review since he's done the most work on openstack.common.cfg.

Mark, what would you think of a change to cfg to allow option aliases for backwards compatibility purposes if an option name gets changed?  Or is there a better way to do that already?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-17 20:49:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Wouldn't be totally against something like that for cfg, but it would see a little pointless to do this for Nova since we change config options so often - i.e. piecemeal backwards compat for config isn't much more useful that no backwards compat"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-17 22:02:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have to agree here, I don't see the point in changing the name of the flag.  Yes its clearer, but it will break people."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-17 22:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Vish, is it worth making option aliasing part of openstack-common for the sake of depreciation?   If not I will abandon this change.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-17 22:49:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think aliasing stuff would be a valuable addition, and with that in place I wouldn't mind this rename.  It needs to go through common first though."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-05-18 16:12:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So SmokeStack uses scheduler_default_filters... so if we make this config change we'll need to update Puppet/Chef as well.

Not sure I see a whole lot of clarity getting adding here... I  probably wouldn't change it myself.

Adding a Launchpad bug ticket for this rename might help keep track of things better too."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-18 19:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dan,  I am going to start looking at adding config option aliasing to openstack common, for the sake of smooth flag renaming.    While I do agree this does not add a whole lot of clarity, it does add some (especially for new users).  Being able to rename options will open the door to making all the config options more user friendly.  Currently OpenStack is hard to configure partially due to poor documentation and option names.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-05-18 20:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This works. The aliases are a great idea for deprecation of config options. Is there a blueprint or anything for the aliases yet? +1 for awaiting the aliases to common.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-18 22:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Created a blueprint for configuration option aliasing in openstack-common.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-common/+spec/config-aliases

Beginning work on; abandoning this patch and will re-submit when config aliasing is done.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-18 22:38:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix Multi_Scheduler to process host capabilities

To fix bug #1000403, make sure that each driver held by the
Multi Scheduler gets called during update_service_capabilities.

Change-Id: Iee8141f1a6dcfa24101640626d209d2d65776339

commit_message:
fixed_ip_get_by_address read_deleted from context

Fixes bug 996482. by default fixed_ip_get_by_address
always sets read_deleted='yes'.  Changed it to accept
read_deleted value from context.
updated .mailmap to rewrite my old email to new email

commit_message:
Add credential quoting to Swift's StoreLocation.

 * Added credential quoting in glance.store.swift.StoreLocation
   to support usernames and passwords that contain '@' characters.
   Without quoting, '@' characters in credentials (e.g. using an
   email address as a username) would result in an exception being
   thrown by parse_uri.
 * Added a migration to support the change in location format.
 * Addresses bug 994296

Change-Id: I92c4f4af914394aada1b4415a42f5a1308187dc4

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-17 19:17:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix glance-api process leak in respawn storm test.

Fixes a glance-api process leak that occurs when running
TestMultiprocessing.test_interrupt_avoids_respawn_storm.

The test code creates an array of pids sorted numerically sorted in
reverse (largest to smallest) meaning the child pids should be at the
top of the list. This patch simply grabs the child pids from the top of
the list instead of relying on the length of the list.

Fixes LP Bug #1000931.

Change-Id: I91d538e686a770778d9855a1bd5a1767cc83842e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix glance-api process leak in respawn storm test.

Fixes a glance-api process leak that occurs when running
TestMultiprocessing.test_interrupt_avoids_respawn_storm.

The test code creates an array of pids sorted numerically sorted in
reverse (largest to smallest) meaning the child pids should be at the
top of the list. This patch simply grabs the child pids from the top of
the list instead of relying on the length of the list.

Fixes LP Bug #1000931.

Change-Id: I91d538e686a770778d9855a1bd5a1767cc83842e

The current implementation of the plug operation tries to assign an IP
address to a bridge even if it already has one. The fix is to do this
only when a new device is created. The check for a new device was
already being performed however the IP address was being set outside

bug 1000580

"}]
commit_message:
Fix for Quantum LinuxBridge Intf driver plug call

The current implementation of the plug operation tries to assign an IP
address to a bridge even if it already has one. The fix is to do this
only when a new device is created. The check for a new device was
already being performed however the IP address was being set outside
that check. That's being corrected here, minor fix.

bug 1000580

Change-Id: I45215a3ca87a32ef4c2a2f76bab9b743eabb525e

commit_message:
Implement get_hypervisor_hostname for libvirt.

Implements get_hypervisor_hostname so that the
OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:hypervisor_hostname extension can properly
display this information when using libvirt.

Fixes LP Bug #999729.

Change-Id: I124d48ca352dc225f88999046f9d212ffb9e4c6e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-04-12 16:40:40.000000000', 'message': 'notify calling process we are ready to serve

Fixes bug 980037

Service managers starting keystone-all have no way of being notified
when the service is ready to accept connections. This commit allows
a configurable command to be called when we are ready e.g.
for systemd setting the statup type of a service unit to "notify" and setting
notify_cmd    = systemd-notify --ready
in keystone.conf, would notify a waiting systemd that we are ready to
serve

In an automated envirnment (e.g. puppet) this will allow the startup of
the keystone-all service (with systemctl for example) directly followed
by usage of the keystone client without the need for a sleep (or retry)
while we are waiting for the keystone service to be ready.

Change-Id: I3f7aafe9837be60a0f35cae1a7db892f6851cc47
'}, {'created': '2012-04-13 09:04:12.000000000', 'message': 'notify calling process we are ready to serve

commit_message:
notify calling process we are ready to serve

Fixes bug 980037

Service managers starting keystone-all have no way of being notified
when the service is ready to accept connections. This commit allows
a configurable command to be called when we are ready e.g.
for systemd setting the statup type of a service unit to "notify" and setting
onready    = systemd-notify --ready
in keystone.conf, would notify a waiting systemd that we are ready to
serve

In an automated envirnment (e.g. puppet) this will allow the startup of
the keystone-all service (with systemctl for example) directly followed
by usage of the keystone client without the need for a sleep (or retry)
while we are waiting for the keystone service to be ready.

Change-Id: I3f7aafe9837be60a0f35cae1a7db892f6851cc47

[{'created': '2012-05-05 04:46:28.000000000', 'message': "Auto generate AUTHORS for python-keystoneclient.

Bug: 976267

Now that git commits are gated by CLA, we shouldn't enforce
committers to add an entry in AUTHORS file. The AUTHORS file
should be generated automatically, based on git commits.

This commit fixes the problem.

* AUTHORS
  Remove this file.

* .gitignore
  Add AUTHORS file.

* keystoneclient/openstack/common/setup.py
  generate_authors(): New method to create AUTHORS file. If
  AUTHORS.in file exists, append it's content to AUTHORS file.

* setup.py
  Import the new method.
  Generate AUTHORS file before creating the package.

* openstack-common.conf
  Add config file to copy libraries from openstack-common project,
  using update.py script.

* keystoneclient/openstack/__init__.py
* keystoneclient/openstack/common/__init__.py
  Add new placeholders.

Change-Id: I1a17ee8f1e19e8ad522f0d2e37c04fffba5e16cb
"}]
commit_message:
Auto generate AUTHORS for python-keystoneclient.

Bug: 976267

Now that git commits are gated by CLA, we shouldn't enforce
committers to add an entry in AUTHORS file. The AUTHORS file
should be generated automatically, based on git commits.

This commit fixes the problem.

* AUTHORS
  Remove this file.

* .gitignore
  Add AUTHORS file.

* keystoneclient/openstack/common/setup.py
  generate_authors(): New method to create AUTHORS file. If
  AUTHORS.in file exists, append it's content to AUTHORS file.

* setup.py
  Import the new method.
  Generate AUTHORS file before creating the package.

* openstack-common.conf
  Add config file to copy libraries from openstack-common project,
  using update.py script.

* keystoneclient/openstack/__init__.py
* keystoneclient/openstack/common/__init__.py
  Add new placeholders.

Change-Id: I1a17ee8f1e19e8ad522f0d2e37c04fffba5e16cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-06 22:39:36.000000000', 'message': 'Truly handle mailmap entries for all combinations.

Bug: 994957

Mailmap might contain mapping with full name. This commit fixes
it to handle these combinations:
  Foo ZZ <email@foo.com> Bar YY <email@bar.com>
  Foo <email@foo.com> Bar <email@bar.com>
  <email@foo.com> <email@bar.com>

This is inline with mailmap convention described here:
  http://man.github.com/git/git-shortlog.html

* keystone/openstack/common/setup.py
  parse_mailmap(): Pull out canonical and alias email addresses.

* keystone/tests/test_setup.py
  New test script to cover various combinations in mailmap.

Change-Id: I471172aa012f37e499e86ffeb74c30ebcdb89b00
'}]
commit_message:
Truly handle mailmap entries for all combinations.

Bug: 994957

Mailmap might contain mapping with full name. This commit fixes
it to handle these combinations:
  Foo ZZ <email@foo.com> Bar YY <email@bar.com>
  Foo <email@foo.com> Bar <email@bar.com>
  <email@foo.com> <email@bar.com>

This is inline with mailmap convention described here:
  http://man.github.com/git/git-shortlog.html

* keystone/openstack/common/setup.py
  parse_mailmap(): Pull out canonical and alias email addresses.

* keystone/tests/test_setup.py
  New test script to cover various combinations in mailmap.

Change-Id: I471172aa012f37e499e86ffeb74c30ebcdb89b00

commit_message:
Added tenant name validation. Fixes bug 966249.

1. Verified name length while creating/updating tenant (for all backends).
2. Disallowed blank tenant name in create/update.
3. Added unit test coverage.

Change-Id: Ied1e2707ba16e14d791308fb618ca18effa0245f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 6, 'name': 'Joe Heck', 'email': 'heckj@mac.com', 'username': 'heckj'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-05-08 10:44:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

AFAICT auth_uri is not the same, it's public API endpoint.

While at it, admin_token shouldn't be documented, admin_user/password/tenant_name are preferred now.

BTW, using URI parameters instead of separate auth_protocol/host/port/ has been discussed, see https://review.openstack.org/7156"}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-05-08 13:38:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

> auth_uri is not the same, it's public API endpoint

Supporting evidence from devstack:
KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT=${KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT:-35357}
KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT=${KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT:-5000}
...
    iniset $GLANCE_API_PASTE_INI filter:authtoken auth_host $KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST
    iniset $GLANCE_API_PASTE_INI filter:authtoken auth_port $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT
    iniset $GLANCE_API_PASTE_INI filter:authtoken auth_protocol $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PROTOCOL
    iniset $GLANCE_API_PASTE_INI filter:authtoken auth_uri $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST:$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT/"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-08 22:15:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

from what I can tell from the code, auth_uri is the same:

in keystone/middleware/auth_token.py

        default_auth_uri = '%s://%s:%s' % (auth_protocol,
                                           self.auth_host,
                                           self.auth_port)
        self.auth_uri = conf.get('auth_uri', default_auth_uri)


As for devstack and glance,  I haven't pushed the associated patch to devestack yet but I have to glance.

https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/f0a0c4a00067b1353fe7f1c677c28458e93297b3"}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-05-09 08:39:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's a bug in code :)
See doc lines you have deleted in your glance commit:
> The ``auth_uri`` variable must point to the Keystone Auth service,
> which is the service users use to obtain Keystone tokens.  > If the user does not have a valid Keystone token, they will be redirected
> to this URI to obtain one.

Users cannot access the admin endpoint, they must go to the public identity endpoint to get a token."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-05-09 16:04:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Concerning auth_uri, I don't see a bug in the code (unless we're looking at different things?).

auth_uri is intended to help direct unauthenticated/unauthorized end users to a public auth endpoint. If no auth_uri is defined, the middleware falls back on providing the auth endpoint used to produce the service token (assuming an admin_token was not explicitly provided... which shouldn't be the case anymore, since it was deprecated). So, assuming an admin_token was not configured, the fallback auth_uri is therefore known to be a valid auth endpoint, although it may NOT be reachable by the end user. Again, it's just a fallback, and auth_uri SHOULD be defined explicitly.

Let me know if got any of that wrong!"}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-05-09 16:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

IMHO bug is to provide an invalid fallback for auth_uri, as you say it should be a public endpoint and a required parameter."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-05-14 17:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, do not remove auth_uri..it is fundamentally different than  the URI used for verifying tokens.  Let us keep them both clearly documented.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-14 22:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Understood.  I will update this patch set to clarify the use of auth_uri and update all associated documentation.

I was thinking of renaming auth_uri to make it clear what it is used for.  Right now auth_uri is very similar to auth_por (what confused me in the first place).  Any suggestions?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-14 22:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

auth_port*'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-17 22:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-17 22:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-05-17 22:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Limiting scope of this patch to just service_* flags

auth_uri/docs cleanup is a much larger patch in scope'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-05-18 09:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-05-18 14:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-05-18 15:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-18 16:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

commit_message:
Nail prettytable test dependency at 0.5.0.

Prettytable 0.6.0 has a bad md5sum in PyPi and as such causes tests
to fail when creating a new venv. Nail the version to 0.5.0.

Fixes LP Bug #1000757.

Change-Id: I121ba8d411e47c2fe154370d9c3c941e25331ce6

[{'created': '2012-05-16 09:55:19.000000000', 'message': "bug 994334 - fixes swift object server config reference

Adds the following options to the Object Server configuration reference:
Variable Service module Default
allowed_headers object_server app:object-server content-disposition,\n content-encoding,\n
x-delete-at,\n x-object-manifest,
mb_per_sync object_server app:object-server 512
expiring_objects_container_divisor object_server DEFAULT 86400
backlog object_server DEFAULT 4096
log_facility object_server DEFAULT 'LOG_LOCAL0'
log_level object_server DEFAULT 'INFO'
log_name object_server DEFAULT 'swift'
log_time object_server object-auditor 3600
zero_byte_files_per_second object_server object-auditor 50
http_timeout object_server object-replicator 60
lockup_timeout object_server object-replicator 1800
recon_cache_path object_server object-replicator '/var/cache/swift'
recon_enable object_server object-replicator 'no'
rsync_io_timeout object_server object-replicator '30'
rsync_timeout object_server object-replicator 900
stats_interval object_server object-replicator '300' (wrong default)
vm_test_mode object_server object-replicator 'no'
auto_create_account_prefix object_server '.'
ring_check_interval object-replicator 15

Change-Id: Ib4568eb5d667424b2a895e8b8ca5265b47391f0f
"}]
commit_message:
bug 994334 - fixes swift object server config reference

Adds the following options to the Object Server configuration reference:
Variable Service module Default
allowed_headers object_server app:object-server content-disposition,\n content-encoding,\n
x-delete-at,\n x-object-manifest,
mb_per_sync object_server app:object-server 512
expiring_objects_container_divisor object_server DEFAULT 86400
backlog object_server DEFAULT 4096
log_facility object_server DEFAULT 'LOG_LOCAL0'
log_level object_server DEFAULT 'INFO'
log_name object_server DEFAULT 'swift'
log_time object_server object-auditor 3600
zero_byte_files_per_second object_server object-auditor 50
http_timeout object_server object-replicator 60
lockup_timeout object_server object-replicator 1800
recon_cache_path object_server object-replicator '/var/cache/swift'
recon_enable object_server object-replicator 'no'
rsync_io_timeout object_server object-replicator '30'
rsync_timeout object_server object-replicator 900
stats_interval object_server object-replicator '300' (wrong default)
vm_test_mode object_server object-replicator 'no'
auto_create_account_prefix object_server '.'
ring_check_interval object-replicator 15

Change-Id: Ib4568eb5d667424b2a895e8b8ca5265b47391f0f

commit_message:
bug 994321 - fixes account server config reference

Adding the following options to the account server configuration reference

delay_reaping account_server account-reaper 0
error_suppression_interval account_server account-replicator 60
error_suppression_limit account_server account-replicator 10
interval account_server account-replicator 30
max_diffs account_server account-replicator 100
vm_test_mode account_server account-replicator 'no'
log_requests account_server app:account-server 't'
backlog account_server DEFAULT 4096
db_preallocation account_server DEFAULT 't'
auto_create_account_prefix account_server '.'

Change-Id: I336dbdcfd8699377d01d87b0c1befd9c17371c86

subject: Move validate_image into utils
messages:
[{'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-10 13:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Julien,

If the goal is to share this logic with nova, the correct approach IMO would be to:

1. Promote this code to openstack-common: http://wiki.openstack.org/CommonLibrary

2. Pending an openstack-common release, copy the shared code into both nova and glance via the update.py script

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-10 14:21:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Additionally, Nova shouldn't really be writing to Glance, it should be writing to a spec. We offer a handy client in Glance that speaks the spec, but you can't rely on backend logic like this in Nova. If you *really* need to make the same check in the fake, you can duplicate it."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-10 14:22:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Eoghann: Eh, I could go either way on this, I think.  We already require the glance client class in nova, and the particular need here is to apply the validate_image() to image parameters that nova is handling.  Since it remains glance-specific, you could consider it part of the glance client API, which would make moving it around in here appropriate, as opposed to putting it in openstack-common.  This would also allow pure clients (other than nova) to apply the same logic.

(That said, I haven't closely looked at Julien's patch yet, but it looks like, up front, he's just copying the function into a second place, which obviously isn't the way we want to go, since it violates DRY.)"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-05-10 14:44:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not copying, I'm moving the function from internal db API to glance.utils."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-10 14:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I see that now :)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-18 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-18 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

Quantum Integration with Horizon

- Cann attach ports to instance interfaces.
- Tests added for API wrapper and views.
- All operations currently in user panels.

subject: Make sure we quote user_token before validating it
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-04-05 19:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-04-12 20:27:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

it sort of seems like this is the client's responsibility?

if they don't send their data correctly then how should we know what to do with it? if there are already quoted characters in there what happens then?

-2 pending further discussion"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-04-13 08:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Well I agree than in general this should be the client responsibility but the server should not crash if the client is doing it wrongly.

Why the server come back with 200 when there is a space in the validation process, I and dolphm could not find the root of the cause.

As for the question, "if there are already quoted characters in there what happens then?", it would get to the same result as with or without this patch -- it would not work..'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-04-25 16:24:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

if the client does not quote it correctly we have no idea what they are trying to send, and if they did quote it correctly, quoting it again will produce the wrong data

>>> import urllib
>>> urllib.quote('asda asda')
'asda%20asda'
>>> urllib.quote(urllib.quote('asda asda'))
'asda%2520asda'"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-04-25 16:26:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(same applies for urllib2's quote function)"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-01 10:02:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, so I'm not sure what we can do to fix https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/974319 should we just leave as it is and say it's a client error?"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-05-03 19:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

certainly appears to be client error to me, but more comments coming on the bug'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-18 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-18 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

[{'created': '2012-05-16 17:11:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix type of snapshot_id column to match db

 * Migrations create a snaphsot_id column that is an integer, but
   models incorrectly list it as a string.
 * The above issue causes errors in certain situations when trying
   to list instances. It seems to be only certain db configurations
   or versions of sqlalchemy that exhibit the issue.
 * Issue was fixed in trunk as part of a conversion to uuids in
   commit 407e16b863bac1dfbf4e954837009abf9c17f018 so a straight
   backport is not possible
 * Fixes bug 962615

Change-Id: I8e9fc9712c141822890feffee838faf8b41ee4f5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix type of snapshot_id column to match db

 * Migrations create a snaphsot_id column that is an integer, but
   models incorrectly list it as a string.
 * The above issue causes errors in certain situations when trying
   to list instances. It seems to be only certain db configurations
   or versions of sqlalchemy that exhibit the issue.
 * Issue was fixed in trunk as part of a conversion to uuids in
   commit 407e16b863bac1dfbf4e954837009abf9c17f018 so a straight
   backport is not possible
 * Fixes bug 962615

Change-Id: I8e9fc9712c141822890feffee838faf8b41ee4f5

commit_message:
Generate a Changelog for Nova

Ubuntu uses a tarball to generate packages for Nova and
other openstack projects. This allows the user to find out
what is included in the tarball.

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

Change-Id: I0291e19eee1ff2c5fc98b499571b2563841c6076

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/374/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Approved

Thanks Gary for this patch. I have verified this along with a fix for the interface driver in nova (bug 1000580) and I able to create VMs on the default public network as well. However, a VM on the default public network is not able to reach the meta-data server: 169.254.169.254. This does not happen with the VMs created on other networks (the networks belong to that tenant). At this point, I don't think this has anything to do with the changes made in this patch. Given that this already has multiple reviews and one +2 from a core reviewer, I am approving it."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Note the ifconfig command output only changed very recently to make the presented code valid.

I suggest instead you use the `ip link ls` as a _fallback_ if `ip tuntap` doesn't work"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think it would be more accurate to fall back,
rather than relying on the names?

try:
  retval = self.run_cmd(['ip', 'tuntap'])
  name_field = 0
except Exception:
  retval = self.run_cmd(['ip', 'link'])
  name_field = 1"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think a change as per the comment is required.
It makes the check a lot more general in any case"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

cheers'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (3 inline comments)

looking good.
Some comments though'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (4 inline comments)

nearly there'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

cheers'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: No score

Maru I agree that the default should be to check.
Looking at the nova equivalent execute() in nova/utils.py,
it checks that the return is 0 by default.

However, than impacts all existing run_cmd() calls.
I think that might be best tackled as a separate change?'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

Just clarifying Maru's good suggestion inline.

Also Gary it would be cool to give a better summary.
In git the first line is the summary, used in many places,
so just listing the bug number is less that informative.
As you've done correctly, the summary line must be
followed by a blank line. I usually move the bug reference
down beside the gerrit reference.

I suggest changing the summary line to:

    fall back to `ip link` when `ip tuntap` unavailable

cheers."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

\o/'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Some concerns inline."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Much improved, but I would appreciate feedback on my check_return comment."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-17 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
fall back to `ip link` when `ip tuntap` unavailable
bug 989868

In the event that the command "ip tuntap" is not found then a exception will
be raised and the command "ip link" will be perfomed.

Changes following comments

More appropriate error message

Same style for log/error messages

Change-Id: Ia912e189b73dd0d112b7ef4eefbb7245ee595b54

commit_message:
Fixed issues with identity and image

* Removes an unused TENANT=... line
* Added a missing \ in a keystone command
* Moved glance database sync to before restarting service
* Added some semantic markup

* Patched to remove extra file path text.

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/7442

Change-Id: Ice95034c99d9cd4f3951a16d03db166e0bd26f21

Hey Russel.

Looks good. Couple of comments inline.

Also. We should agree on how we do the copyrights. Are we using '(c)' or not?"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-14 14:17:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Regarding the copyright ... I really don't have a preference.  I think I was mostly just emulating other copyright statements in the code.  If you have a preference for another format, I can swap them."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-14 14:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The (c) thing is meaningless IMHO'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-14 14:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-15 21:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-15 23:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

one minor mistake in a comment. I won't hold up the patch, but if you end up having to repush, fix it."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-16 06:58:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

See inline."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-16 12:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

I had to rebase to fix some conflicts that I introduced.  I won't do that again while this is still in review ..."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-16 16:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-16 16:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

sorry for so many updates ... just staying on top of conflicts'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-16 16:37:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

Replied inline about previous comment.

I'm not a huge fan of mix-ins.  Hm.  I have an idea about the dispatching that I want to see what you think about.  I'll throw up an idea real quick on my github.  Give me a few and I'll link it here. :)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-16 17:30:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

https://github.com/comstud/nova/commit/ca693ab80ec03ef1ef684ba7c334c3d40f05d3b6

This essentially lets the manager create its RpcDispatcher, passing itself in along with a version.  This gets rid of the API_VERSION attr magic, although I'm not sure if I quite like what I did there.  I guess I kind of like the API_VERSION attr, although I'd probably call it RPC_API_VERSION if you want to keep it.

The part I think is a bit more flexible is the nova/service.py and nova/manager.py changes in my above commit...  so that we're not required to mix-in the RpcDispatcher with the manager.

I could see cases where a single Manager might want to define some classes specifically for separating out different types of rpc calls.

For example:

class RpcCallSetX(object):
    pass
class RpcCallSetY(object):
    pass

class SomeManager(manager.Manager):
    def create_rpc_dispatcher(self):
        return rpc_dispatcher.RpcDispatcher([(RpcCallSetX(), '1.0'), (RpcCallSetY(), '1.0')])

This would actually come in very handy for my nova-cells service which does a few different types of work."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-16 21:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-16 21:46:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(3 inline comments)

I'm going to +2, because my comments are rather minor.. and I don't want to hold this up.

Thanks for incorporating my feedback.. :)  And good job, I'm liking how this is looking."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-05-16 22:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-05-17 02:03:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm good with this too. Waiting a bit longer before sending to see if anyone else has feedback."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-17 16:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-05-17 16:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-14 13:38:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add base support for rpc API versioning.

Part of blueprint versioned-rpc-apis.

This commit includes the base support for versioned RPC APIs.  It
introduces the RpcProxy and RpcDispatcher classes that have common code
for handling versioning on the client and server sides, respectively.

RPC APIs will be converted one at a time using this infrastructure.

Change-Id: I07bd82e9ff60c356123950e466caaffdfce79eba

commit_message:
Add base support for rpc API versioning.

Part of blueprint versioned-rpc-apis.

This commit includes the base support for versioned RPC APIs.  It
introduces the RpcProxy and RpcDispatcher classes that have common code
for handling versioning on the client and server sides, respectively.

RPC APIs will be converted one at a time using this infrastructure.

Change-Id: I07bd82e9ff60c356123950e466caaffdfce79eba

* added minimal tests for changes in Attach class

commit_message:
Fix depricated /users/{user-id}/roles

* user-only roles are apparently depricated and not implemented, but
  the AdminRouter is incorrect, resulting in a stack trace rather than
  the expected not-implemented message.  As long as it is in the code,
  it might as well point to the right place...

Change-Id: I923249e44e56e79ab088235a4e87277e6ad65deb

allows you to connect over telnet and receive a Python prompt on a running
server. This is immensely helpful for debugging running systems.

Change-Id: I779247a0796d34ba2a5478436d85b30ba76c4a01

commit_message:
Add eventlet backdoor to facilitate troubleshooting.

This provides a FLAG to turn on Eventlet's builtin backdoor server which
allows you to connect over telnet and receive a Python prompt (which is
immensely helpful for debugging running systems).

Fixes bug 1000366

Change-Id: I779247a0796d34ba2a5478436d85b30ba76c4a01

commit_message:
Add support for using Qpid instead of RabbitMQ.

To use Qpid instead of RabbitMQ, you set 'qpid' instead of 'rabbit' in
ENABLED_SERVICES in your localrc file. Otherwise, RabbitMQ is still
used by default.

(dtroyer) fixed problem with service test that failed to configure
rabbitmq if it was still selected.

Change-Id: I8c62b588a461a068463821b2c079ffa4bfa1f804

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-17 17:29:45.000000000', 'message': 'fixes typo that completely broken Quantum/Nova integration

bug 1000887

fixes bug introduced in ba76b954e69de56f76f9db5cade1780bc351be67 that
prevented the serializer in the Quantum client code from correctly
serializing request body data.  Instead, the serializer always returned
None, meaning that requests would have no body, causing the Quantum
server to return a 400.

Change-Id: I410fb408435da8774f418f0e62ffb59eac2354f3
'}]
commit_message:
fixes typo that completely broken Quantum/Nova integration

bug 1000887

fixes bug introduced in ba76b954e69de56f76f9db5cade1780bc351be67 that
prevented the serializer in the Quantum client code from correctly
serializing request body data.  Instead, the serializer always returned
None, meaning that requests would have no body, causing the Quantum
server to return a 400.

Change-Id: I410fb408435da8774f418f0e62ffb59eac2354f3

commit_message:
Set rabbit_host to ip, not localhost

This change specifies an IP address for the rabbitmq server. If this isn't
set, then all nova services on nodes other than the controller will fail.

Also removed the customized rabbit password, since there's nothing in the
docs right now that discusses changing the default rabbitmq password.

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/7448

Change-Id: If092e141e2922961085257292c8a618bd183aeb9

commit_message:
Make Iptables FW Driver handle dhcp_server None.

Updates the IptablesFirewallDriver so it doesn't set iptables rules
for the DHCP server if dhcp_server is None in network info.

Fixes LP Bug #1000522.

Change-Id: I08bcae49fb75f685c9eab4e10936fdab5b304e2b

commit_message:
Add min_ram and min_disk to bin/glance help.

The min_ram and min_disk fields are supported for both glance add and
glance update, so this change adds a description of those fields to the
glance help (add|update) comment fields.

Change-Id: Ib6ca980e29ad7062eaaa10cde8705f9248d2e3b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-16 20:36:29.000000000', 'message': "handle updated qemu-img info output

Originally `qemu-img info` always output an (actual path: ...)
even if it was duplicated with that already on the line.

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083... (actual path: $the_same)

Whereas after the change referenced at:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2012-05/msg01468.html
It suppresses a duplicate (actual path:)

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083...

* nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py (get_disk_backing_file):
Avoid an indexError exception when parsing the newer format.
Fixes bug 1000261

Change-Id: Ie2889b6da8a5c93e0e874e7a330529f6e6e71b0b
(cherry picked from commit 0624b7aab0c0fe4869111ad8e302151548d6ba20)
"}]
commit_message:
handle updated qemu-img info output

Originally `qemu-img info` always output an (actual path: ...)
even if it was duplicated with that already on the line.

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083... (actual path: $the_same)

Whereas after the change referenced at:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2012-05/msg01468.html
It suppresses a duplicate (actual path:)

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083...

* nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py (get_disk_backing_file):
Avoid an indexError exception when parsing the newer format.
Fixes bug 1000261

Change-Id: Ie2889b6da8a5c93e0e874e7a330529f6e6e71b0b
(cherry picked from commit 0624b7aab0c0fe4869111ad8e302151548d6ba20)

commit_message:
Align tox with standards.

Moved openstack nose invocation to tox.ini from setup.cfg, as there
is no way to turn it off if it's in setup.cfg, and when we're running
in jenkins, we want to run via xunit and not via openstack color output.

Change-Id: I0a7b6232834b5cdfc97be9c2f93f726d6b47e0ac

commit_message:
Remove old flagfile support.

Implements blueprint remove-old-flagfile

nova-manage can still be used to convert old flagfiles style files
to new .ini files:

$ ./bin/nova-manage  config  convert --help
Usage: nova-manage config convert <args> [options]

Options:
  -h, --help        show this help message and exit
  --infile=<path>   old-style flagfile to convert to config
  --outfile=<path>  path for output file. Writes configto stdout if not
                    specified.

Change-Id: Ib8fbbd858b1db7faef70d7d97955e5042bf378f2
Signed-off-by: Ghe Rivero <ghe@debian.org>

messages:
[{'account_id': 518, 'date': '2012-05-02 12:22:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Is the original, un-resized VM not still in perfectly good shape? If it is, it seems wrong to set the vm_state to ERROR when it's actually still fully functional. Do we do the same elsewhere?"}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-05-03 06:08:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The un-resized instance is running fine, however, the user cannot stop/reboot the instance (since it remains in resizing state even after the network node comes up).
A similar approach is followed in 'prep_resize' method where if the allow_resize_to_same_host is False and same Compute host is selected for resize, the instance vm_state will be set to ERROR."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-11 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

subject: Add script to delete templates
messages:
[{'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-05-16 17:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lol - I had a script on my xenserver that did this as well, but I forgot to propose it:

UUID=`xe template-list  | grep -1 "Ubuntu 11.10 (64-bit)" | grep uuid | sed s"/uuid.*\: //g"`
if [ "$UUID" ]; then
    xe template-param-set other-config:default_template=false uuid=$UUID
    xe template-param-set is-a-template=false uuid=$UUID
    xe vm-destroy uuid=$UUID
fi

note that first line - keeps me from having to type each time I do this.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-05-16 18:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Add s3_listen and s3_listen_port options.

Adds s3_listen and s3_listen_port options to the Nova Objectstore
service so that it matches config options from other Nova API services.

Fixes LP Bug #1000220.

Change-Id: Ie6d89af7fc8de0c5cef846315171d0f9c9e3db35

* nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py (get_disk_backing_file):
Avoid an indexError exception due to the new qemu-img info
output format, triggered by this upstream patch:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2012-05/msg01468.html
This causes the '(actual path: ...)' portion not to be printed
unless it's different to the other path on the line.

Change-Id: Ie2889b6da8a5c93e0e874e7a330529f6e6e71b0b
"}, {'created': '2012-05-16 14:53:53.000000000', 'message': "handle updated qemu-img info output

Originally `qemu-img info` always output an (actual path: ...)
even if it was duplicated with that already on the line.

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083... (actual path: $the_same)

Whereas after the change referenced at:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2012-05/msg01468.html
It suppresses a duplicate (actual path:)

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083...

* nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py (get_disk_backing_file):
Avoid an indexError exception when parsing the newer format.
Fixes bug 1000261

Change-Id: Ie2889b6da8a5c93e0e874e7a330529f6e6e71b0b
"}]
commit_message:
handle updated qemu-img info output

Originally `qemu-img info` always output an (actual path: ...)
even if it was duplicated with that already on the line.

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083... (actual path: $the_same)

Whereas after the change referenced at:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2012-05/msg01468.html
It suppresses a duplicate (actual path:)

 $ instances=/var/lib/nova/instances/
 $ qemu-img info $instances/instance-00000017/disk | grep 'backing'
 backing file: $instances/_base/24083...

* nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py (get_disk_backing_file):
Avoid an indexError exception when parsing the newer format.
Fixes bug 1000261

Change-Id: Ie2889b6da8a5c93e0e874e7a330529f6e6e71b0b

commit_message:
Cisco plugin CLI call to quantumclient CLI

when Cisco plugin CLI is used, it wil call the quantumclient CLI if the command is not in its extensions.
the version of the Quantum API must be specified when the the Cisco plugin CLI is looking for Quantum commands.

Bug 1000251

Change-Id: I3e4039edb7cb79411fc60677ef6f99fca8007dc9

messages:
[{'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-05-16 16:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-16 16:09:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Rick: Should be fine..  The tpool.execute() waited for the task to finish already before returning, so this doesn't change that behavior.  And I tested making a synchronous call to a plugin that I had sit and spin for a while... and verified other greenthreads were still running."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-05-16 16:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

The commit message says it doesn't block ... so ...

Not sure if that also implies it's safe.

Too bad it's impossible to have a test just for thread safety here."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-05-16 17:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Sandy: My message could have been more clear.  I meant that it doesn't completely block the python process because the socket work is definitely completely wrapped by eventlet.  I think the use of tpool was there before because it was thought the SSL module could not be wrapped by eventlet.  But, it appears that it is.

The calls did always block waiting for a response before... so this doesn't change that.  I just meant another greenthreads are still able to run while blocking.  I verified this with a test program.

Thnx!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-16 18:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

commit_message:
Remove XenAPI use of eventlet tpool

XenAPI implementation does not block, even with it using SSL, therefore
there's no need to use eventlet's tpool.

Change-Id: I33ef4140068c8af06d27a075f52379581790c647

commit_message:
bug 988550: devstack installer for xenserver to support user-defined ubuntu mirror

add support for local mirrors by:

- making sure the preseed file points to a local mirror.
- the apt sources mounted in the DevStack VM will point automatically to the same mirrror

Change-Id: I33052ac5c10387db7206ce2210ee2cbe9096df47

[{'created': '2012-05-10 15:26:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP #996571 - Alternate Tempest user

Adds an alternate user to Keystone for Tempest

Tempest has a number of tests that are skipped if
the compute.alt_username is the same as compute.username
or None. Here, we modify files/keystone_data.sh to add
an additional regular user called alt_demo if Tempest
is enabled in stackrc. We also make corresponding changes
to the tools/configure_tempest.sh script to make use
of this alternate user credential

Change-Id: I551f3b378f843c62fffcf6effa916056708d54d3
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP #996571 - Alternate Tempest user

Adds an alternate user to Keystone for Tempest

Tempest has a number of tests that are skipped if
the compute.alt_username is the same as compute.username
or None. Here, we modify files/keystone_data.sh to add
an additional regular user called alt_demo if Tempest
is enabled in stackrc. We also make corresponding changes
to the tools/configure_tempest.sh script to make use
of this alternate user credential

Change-Id: I551f3b378f843c62fffcf6effa916056708d54d3

[{'created': '2012-05-15 16:33:35.000000000', 'message': "Set rabbit_host to ip, not localhost

This change specifies an IP address for the rabbitmq server. If this isn't
set, then all nova services on nodes other than the controller will fail.

Also removed the customized rabbit password, since there's nothing in the
docs right now that discusses changing the default rabbitmq password.

Change-Id: If092e141e2922961085257292c8a618bd183aeb9
"}]
commit_message:
Set rabbit_host to ip, not localhost

This change specifies an IP address for the rabbitmq server. If this isn't
set, then all nova services on nodes other than the controller will fail.

Also removed the customized rabbit password, since there's nothing in the
docs right now that discusses changing the default rabbitmq password.

Change-Id: If092e141e2922961085257292c8a618bd183aeb9

commit_message:
Run pep8 on tests.

I noticed that pep8 wasn't running on the tests.  This patch fixes that,
as well as a couple of pep8 errors in test_cfg.

Change-Id: I4429bfe6813a2e9394efb1753cbebbadb9f23833

subject: Rearchitect quota checking to partially fix bug 938317.

messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-04-24 21:16:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(8 inline comments)

Overall, excellent work Kevin. I have a few smallish comments inline, but very impressed with this.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-25 15:00:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

Thanks for your kind words, sir :)  See inline for responses.  I'll wait for more input from you before submitting an updated patchset."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-25 17:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

Upcoming review; still looking for input on my responses to your comments…'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-04-25 17:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Hey Kevin, thx for the commentary! Much better understood now. See my inline suggestion for naming of the resource classes. :)'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-04-25 18:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Kevin,

Overall great work, glad to see the quotas will start actually working soon. 

* Did bug 938317 allow for oversubscribing cores beyond the limits defined by the scheduler or just beyond the limits defined by quotas?

* If a reservation expires once a VM is up, this doesn't need to be done as a periodic task, but can be synced up to the VM state changes (delete reservation on VM state: ERROR, and move to in-use on VM state: RUNNING).

* As per discussions in the Folsom Summit it would be nice to have this live in a long term branch until it is fully baked (as described by your TODO list), so half completed features stop making it into releases."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-25 19:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Joe:

* As I read bug 938317, it is a problem with enforcing quotas, rather than scheduler limits.  The lack of atomicity was obvious as soon as it was pointed out, and that's all I'm trying to address.

* The reservation expire periodic task is intended to catch the case where a bug causes the reservation to be neither committed nor rolled back; e.g., we hit "nova boot", check and pass quota, but then something crashes before the instance actually gets built.  The normal case will be for reservations to be committed when the instance is finished building or to be rolled back if we go to error.  (Part of the reason for me going ahead and submitting this now is to solicit help with setting up the appropriate reserve, commit, and rollback calls.)

* Actually, I had completely forgotten about the long-term branch discussion, particularly given that I had started work on this branch a week or two before the summit.  That said, I have pointed people to my branch (github.com/klmitch/nova, branch "quota-atomicity") without getting any comments or suggestions…'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-25 22:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-26 17:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-04-26 17:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Kevin,

* I asked about scheduler limits because the same problem would in theory exist there (but I am under the impression this has already been fixed with scheduler limits).  So fixing quota enforcement without looking at scheduler limit enforcing may result in duplicate functionality.

*  Using a 'reservation expire periodic task,' sounds like trying to work around a problem rather then fixing it in the first place.  The VM state logic should be able to handle something crashing and if it does not, it needs to be fixed (since Folsom is so far away there should be plenty of time to test).   I think tighter integration between quotas and VM state logic/scheduling is a cleaner approach.

* As for long term branch, one option is to just -2 this branch and label as WIP.  It is easier for most people to track WIP branches here then in a 3rd party location."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-04-26 17:43:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Kevin,

Made one note on the DB migrations."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-27 02:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-27 14:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-04-27 18:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

++'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-04-27 20:37:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I would like to see some of the other TODOs added into this patch before it gets merged in.  Otherwise this may end up as yet another half baked nova feature.

TODOs such as ' Remove old quota code and consolidate'  and 'Use new quota interface for all existing quotas'"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-27 20:46:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Indeed, I hear you on that topic, but I figured that this patch was getting large enough that it'd be difficult to get reviews if it got much larger.  In addition, I was hoping I could get others with more familiarity with the relevant nova systems to help me update them to match the new quota system."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-04-30 23:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-02 23:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-05 00:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-08 11:20:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please use a feature branch for this rather than "WIP" reviews in gerrit. See https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg11355.html'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-11 23:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-14 17:51:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

1 comment inline.. I'll come back to this in a bit if it's not merged yet."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-14 17:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-05-14 20:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-05-14 22:09:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-15 16:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-05-15 18:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (6 inline comments)

Overall looks good.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-15 18:42:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: (6 inline comments)

Thanks, kind sir :)  I'll work on a couple of these items…"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-15 19:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-15 19:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Kevin: the engine should be set on all new tables, but the utf8 charset is set for the whole db in an earlier migration so it is not needed.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-05-15 21:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-16 02:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-16 05:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The implementation looks good to me.  I am a little concerned with how we get this into cinder (and quantum).  Do we add in a driver where the quotas are stored somewhere else (keystone and passed in the context?) and move this into openstack-common?'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-16 14:46:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Vish: Yeah, that's a good future direction."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-05-16 15:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-16 15:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-05-16 15:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Rearchitect quota checking to partially fix bug 938317.

This is a rearchitecting/rewriting of quota handling to correct the
quota atomicity issues highlighted by bug 938317.  Partially implements
blueprint quota-refactor as well.

This change is fairly substantial.  To make it easier to review, it has been
broken up into 3 parts.  This is the first part.

Change-Id: I805f5750c08de17487e59fe33fad0bed203188a6

commit_message:
Misused and not used config options

Fixes bug #1000071

[nova.flag.py]
stub_network: StrOpt -> BoolOpt

[nova.api.sizelimit.py]
osapi_max_request_body_size: BoolOpt -> IntOpt

[nova.compute.api.py]
find_host_timeout: not used

[nova.rpc.__init__.py]
allowed_rpc_exception_modules: IntOpt -> ListOpt

[nova.virt.vmwareapi_conn.py]
vmwareapi_api_retry_count: FloatOpt -> IntOpt

[nova.volume.driver.py]
num_shell_tries: StrOpt -> IntOpt
num_iscsi_scan_tries: StrOpt -> IntOpt

[nova.volume.driver.py]
san_thin_provision: 'true' -> True
san_is_local: 'false' -> False

Change-Id: I07ab60b1d881c9475f4f2517a432f1e934d8ae52

commit_message:
Calling Super method from QuantumPortAwareScheduler.__init__

the quantum.plugins.cisco.nova.quantum_port_aware_scheduler.QuantumPortAwareScheduler class wasn't calling its superclass __init__.
the host_manager attribute of driver.Scheduler class wasn't initialized, and the scheduler was crashing when it was receiving a host message via amqp.

Fixes bug 994652

Change-Id: I733d80df8f87ff314f4233b10fa8afaf454eedf0

commit_message:
Make use of openstack.common.jsonutils.

This patch imports jsonutils from openstack-common.  It removes the
equivalent code from nova.utils and then converts the code base to use
jsonutils.  The primary motivator for this change was to remove the rest
of the dependencies from nova.rpc on nova.utils.

Change-Id: If43658b9b098ed56cba018c81be268b8c3e2916a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-15 19:44:21.000000000', 'message': "Stop using nova.exception from nova.rpc.

This patch is a part of continuing to remove dependencies from nova.rpc
on the rest of nova.  One RPC related exception was defined in
nova.exception, so that was moved to nova.rpc.common where the rest of
them live.  These exceptions were changed to no longer use NovaException
as their base.  Instead, there is a new RPCException base.

One other change that should be reviewed closely is the removal of using
nova.exception.wrap_exception() in nova.rpc.amqp.  As far as I can tell,
this didn't actually do anything since nothing was being passed in to
wrap_exception().

Change-Id: I36ff7c05ab0467ad8506b56d561c532eadf8dff8
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using nova.exception from nova.rpc.

This patch is a part of continuing to remove dependencies from nova.rpc
on the rest of nova.  One RPC related exception was defined in
nova.exception, so that was moved to nova.rpc.common where the rest of
them live.  These exceptions were changed to no longer use NovaException
as their base.  Instead, there is a new RPCException base.

One other change that should be reviewed closely is the removal of using
nova.exception.wrap_exception() in nova.rpc.amqp.  As far as I can tell,
this didn't actually do anything since nothing was being passed in to
wrap_exception().

Change-Id: I36ff7c05ab0467ad8506b56d561c532eadf8dff8

I would like to see the code pulled out of xenapi and libvirt and done in the manager instead."}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-04-11 09:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-04-11 09:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Can someone please review this and prevent from being auto-abandoned by Gerrit due to inactivity.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-04-23 15:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-04-25 06:34:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I find it incredibly ugly that we are calling compute.api from the manager layer. It seems to be so that we don't have to duplicate management code?

Since we are already calling into compute api from the driver layer (which i think is even worse), I'm ok with this patch going in.  We are trying to get compute to stop having access to the database however so I suspect this will have to move again.

Just marking this +1 for now. So that people can comment on this. Perhaps there is a reasonable solution that could be implemented now. Otherwise we can push this through and fix it later."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-04-25 17:20:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Agree with Vish:

Calling a compute API method here is ugly, and there's very little functionality in the compute API method, so it could be trivial to move into the confirm_resize method at the manager level. Beyond that, we're taking multiple trips to the database for the same migration records because we're calling back the the API."}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-04-26 09:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Vish, Matt: I too agree on moving api code (of confirm_resize method) to manager would be a better approach. 
Will wait for any comments on this approach and submit an updated patch if there are no alternative solutions.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-04-26 17:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I actually think we should merge this as is and deal with moving it in a later patch.  It isn't making it any worse than it already is. We are trying to move to the compute node not writing to the database, so It will probably need to be changed into a state update passed back.

Matt?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-04 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-04 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Fixed compute periodic task. Fixes bug 973331.

1. Moved the poll_unconfirmed_resizes implementation to compute manager (as
it is not hypervisor specific).
2. Added unit test case coverage.

Change-Id: Ic58502f44326c5d59439087b4fa9ae7aa79c1e17

I think you also need to nuke the release_fixed_ip function so that it falls through instead of doing nothing."}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-03 20:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-03 21:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4196, 'date': '2012-05-03 21:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(2 inline comments)

I'm going to take a look at reworking this patch, as I think some of this logic belongs in the IPAM lib. 

Also, my testing of this showed some bad interactions with DHCP, where nova will re-allocate an IP even if the DHCP lease has not expired."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-07 21:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-05-07 23:24:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)
