(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-05-08 00:46:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ok, I have tested this and I seem to have it working for both the DHCP and non-DHCP case.  

As I mentioned, the only part of the existing diff that I think we need is the part that deletes the definition of release_fixed_ip() in QuantumManager, so it properly inherits.  

To get the non-DHCP case working, we can rely on the periodic task to disassociate un-allocated IPs, but we need to set the following as an attribute of the QuantumManager: 

timeout_fixed_ips = True

Currently, QuantumManager is inheriting timeout_fixed_ips = False from FlatManager, meaning that if you're not using DHCP, IPs never get reclaimed. 

Vish, please comment if this doesn't seem right."}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-11 22:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-11 22:43:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-11 22:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-11 22:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-11 22:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-05-13 17:25:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

I've tested this on my setup and it works both when DHCP is and is not in use."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-14 14:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-05-14 14:54:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

The commenting additions need to be reconsidered. See inline."}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-15 00:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-05-15 00:41:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (5 inline comments)

I have fixed all the concerns that were raised. I did let one block of comment stay in the code so that a future maintainer of this code can have a easier time figuring out the nuanced nature of this bug. Hope that's ok."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-15 15:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-01 00:42:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug 988034 - Quantum Network Manager - not clearing ips

In QuantumManager, IPs were supposed to be cleared in deallocate_for_instance
as per comment above release_fixed_p() unfortunately, the delete
logic wasn't implemented in deallocate_for_instance. This changeset corrects
that behavior.

Change-Id: Ic2ad1e87441c448c10ff097b28d2b6347eef5401
"}, {'created': '2012-05-01 16:32:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug 988034 - Quantum Network Manager - not clearing ips

as per comment above release_fixed_p() unfortunately, the delete
logic wasn't implemented in deallocate_for_instance. This changeset corrects
that behavior.

Also added an entry to authors file.

Change-Id: Ic2ad1e87441c448c10ff097b28d2b6347eef5401

commit_message:
Fix bug 988034 - Quantum Network Manager - not clearing ips

Added a line in nova_ipam_lib.QuantumNovaIPAMLib init
method to ensure we clean up IPs and explanation of whats
going on.

Also, nuked release_fixed_ip as that is not
needed in QuantumManager anymore.

Change-Id: Ic2ad1e87441c448c10ff097b28d2b6347eef5401

commit_message:
Isolates base_tests.py from "real" dashboards.

Creates a set of test dashboards for testing core components
so that they're not affected by changes to the OpenStack
dashboards which should be completely independent.

Fixes bug 999357.

Change-Id: I78e70eaf32a639db5c87a3c03377dc2a02d66ad9

commit_message:
Include AUTHORS in release package.

Fixes Bug #976267.

Include AUTHORS file in release package. The file is generated
automatically from git. Handle different combination for mailmap
records. Include test case to verify this fix.

* MANIFEST.in
  Include AUTHORS file in release package.

* .gitignore
  Add AUTHORS file.

* quantum/openstack/common/setup.py
  generate_authors(): New method to create AUTHORS file. If
  AUTHORS.in file exists, append it's content to AUTHORS file.
  parse_mailmap(): Handle all mailmap combination while parsing.

* setup.py
  Import the new method.
  Generate AUTHORS file before creating the package.

* quantum/tests/unit/test_setup.py
  New test script to verify different combination of records
  in mailmap file.

Change-Id: I220e8a20c96d37df3fa2ba0424e8372496e67895

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

Minor nits, most concerned about ensuring 2.4 compatibility."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

Minor nits inline.

dan: There is a mixing of error handling in daemon_loop that needs to be resolved.  Sometimes a db error sets db_connected to False (which causes a wait before reinitializing the db variable), and sometimes a db error calls db.rollback (which resets the session state, allowing subsequent calls to succeed provided the db is back up), and sometimes both.  My suggestion is to remove the db_connected flag entirely.  The db would be initialized once before the loop and the loop would have an exception handler that executes db.rollback and waits for the reconnect interval.  So long as db.rollback is called on error, the db variable need never be reinitialized."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

dan: one more thing - it would probably be preferable to have a global try/except for OVSQuantumAgent.daemon_loop and skip the specific logging for ports and vlans.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

pep8 instructions inline, and a couple of suggestions.  Looks good otherwise."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

daemon loop looks good.  Some nits inline regarding the new Port class."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
OVS plugin: add tunnel ips to central database

bp simplify-ovs-tunnel-mgmt

Makes the OVS plugin agent report its own IP address to the centralized
quantum database, and build its set of tunnels based on the contents of
this centralized database.  This removes the need for a removes need for
a 'remote-ips' file on each compute node that needs to be updated
when a new host is added.

Also:
- simplifies error handling within tunnel manager daemon_loop
- fixes issues with operational status not working for tunnel-mode
- fixes issue that not-stripping vlan of tunneled packet potentially
crashes OVS, causing flows to get wiped.

Change-Id: I4d285669e29beecf745fe620581fa6bc332a446c

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-04-13 20:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-04-14 04:55:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It is the tenant_name, should it be passed by ID ?'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-04-14 22:32:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure if swift requires you to use tenant name or id. Ideally we would be using tenant id, but I don't know if that's possible."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-04-23 05:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Followed up offline, this is good.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-04-23 19:53:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Couple unit test errors on this one:

TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'tenant_name'"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-04-24 10:43:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

The unknown tenant_name parameter for swift.common.client.Connection.__init__() occurs because this was added after the most recent swift 1.4.8 release.

Can the pip-requires dependency on be updated to trunk? e.g. a git hash style dependency, as opposed to a specific released version:

  tools/pip-requires:
  - swift
  + -e git://github.com/openstack/swift.git@<some stable hash>#egg=swift

Also, we're not auto-generating the Authors file as yet, so seeing as this is your first glance commit you'll need to add your name & email to the Authors file, otherwise:

  glance.tests.unit.test_misc.:AuthorsTestCase.test_authors_up_to_date

will fail.

Finally, a minor style comment in-line.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-04-24 16:32:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Eoghan:

To answer your question about a specific git hash, yes, we can do that. We've already done that for Keystone."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-01 14:37:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-01 17:03:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Unfortunately the patch #6698 beat yours to landing on master:

  https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/f4ce37b9

So now you'll have to go back and undo the change to the Authors file (which has been deleted, and is now auto-generated).

Please rebase on latest, then the patch should be good to go.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-02 12:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-02 13:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for your persistence with this!

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-05-03 13:15:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Chmouel,

The following test hangs when running the unit tests on Fedora 16 (python 2.7):

TestImageCacheSqlite:test_cache_remote_image

I merged w/ trunk first... Any idea why?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-04 08:18:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Dan,

As discussed on IRC, that test seems to fail intermittently - the tests ran fine for me on F16/p27 with Chmouel's patch, so I think the failure you saw was unrelated.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-07 19:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Dan: Have you re-run the test suite to determine if that test is continuing to fail?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-05-08 02:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Kevin,

Eoghan is right here. We do seem to be having issues with Glance unit tests hanging (TestImageCacheSqlite:test_cache_remote_image is one of them).

Carry on...'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-08 09:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I guess this is good to merging now right ?'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-08 21:40:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The code appears complete, but I'm hesitant to approve this without seeing it working with devstack. Can you provide a working branch similar to the work you did pre-essex to make that integration work again?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-09 09:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Brian this should be easy to test like this on a fresh checkout of devstack :

git checkout -b swift-update-test && git diff 55e82033^1 55e82033|patch -p1

make sure you add swift to the $ENABLED_SERVICES variable like this :

ENABLED_SERVICES="$ENABLED_SERVICES,swift"

(and obv git review -d 6528 in glance repo before launching stack.sh)'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-09 16:16:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ok, so this kept dying in my vagrant environment, but on a vanilla cloud server I can at least get devstack to complete. However, if I change the code to log the tenant_name variable then boot an instance, tenant_name is always None. Any idea why?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-09 16:39:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Where do you see tenant_name not logging ? 

I have added this in glance :

http://pastie.org/private/6wph1pywnlcjao4v4gdq

and I do see :

2012-05-09 16:38:01 DEBUG [glance.store.swift] HELLO service

in my log (service is indeed the tenant_name by devstack).

You need to use SWIFT_REPLICAS=1 in your localrc to have swift using less memory (this is all specified in devstack's README)"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-15 15:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ping? this has been a over a month review and people are not able to use glance and swift trunk ATM :('}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-15 15:56:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I apologize for allowing this to sit so long. I've attempted to review it several times only to be defeated by something stupid. I'll have feedback for you today, or my name isn't Andy Smith."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-15 19:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Ok, I spun up a new devstack install and everything worked like a charm.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-15 20:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

commit_message:
Update glance to pass properly tenant_name.

- Update glance with the latest changes in swift.common.client.
- Use 5000 for port.
- Properly test v2 in tests.
- Fixes bug 980196.
- Test swift against a specific stable version like for keystone.

Change-Id: Iaff536efc92e78e51d8042010ce0eb407c4a71b2

commit_message:
bug 994652

the quantum.plugins.cisco.nova.quantum_port_aware_scheduler.QuantumPortAwareScheduler class wasn't calling its superclass __init__.
the host_manager attribute of driver.Scheduler class wasn't initialized, and the scheduler was crashing when it was receiving a host message via amqp.

Change-Id: Ie8e22f0d49c85acf55526932fc85ef6dbe2ca148

[{'created': '2012-05-15 14:57:08.000000000', 'message': 'Create openstack.common.jsonutils.

This patch creates a new module, jsonutils.  It is based on some code
from nova.utils that is used by nova.rpc.  It is being added to
openstack-common as another step toward being able to eventually move
nova.rpc to openstack-common.

This module provides a few things:

1) A handy function for getting an object down to something that can
be JSON serialized.  See to_primitive().

2) Wrappers around loads() and dumps().  The dumps() wrapper will
automatically use to_primitive() for you if needed.

3) This sets up anyjson to use the loads() and dumps() wrappers if
anyjson is available.

Change-Id: I41e5759360d515ed53defe69f3e8247aafbcc83a

commit_message:
Create openstack.common.jsonutils.

This patch creates a new module, jsonutils.  It is based on some code
from nova.utils that is used by nova.rpc.  It is being added to
openstack-common as another step toward being able to eventually move
nova.rpc to openstack-common.

This module provides a few things:

1) A handy function for getting an object down to something that can
be JSON serialized.  See to_primitive().

2) Wrappers around loads() and dumps().  The dumps() wrapper will
automatically use to_primitive() for you if needed.

3) This sets up anyjson to use the loads() and dumps() wrappers if
anyjson is available.

Change-Id: I41e5759360d515ed53defe69f3e8247aafbcc83a

subject: Implements user/tenant get_by_name API.
messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-04-23 16:40:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

There's actually a core spec for this, which simply isn't implemented in Keystone today:

    /v2.0/users?name={user_name}
    /v2.0/tenants?name={tenant_name}

http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity-service/2.0/content/api_operations.html

It was a non-critical feature that didn't make it past the architectural redux of keystone, but I'd very much like to see it implemented for folsom as it was before. Users are certainly looking for this capability from the CLI.

So, -2 simply for implementing as an extension :) Would love to +2 for core."}, {'account_id': 1188, 'date': '2012-04-23 21:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-04-24 18:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

I've replied Maru Newby inline comments showing the error messages looks good, however I'm no really sure about this, probably would a better approach add a new exception with a more suitable message."}, {'account_id': 1188, 'date': '2012-04-24 19:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-04-24 19:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-04-25 16:59:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not submit

this feature was explicitly decided against in a previous patch, i haven't changed my mind about it but you are welcome to start the discussion again"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-04-25 18:06:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

discussion went as follows:

this is a feature i don't think we need, the suggested implementations are ugly, we should save it for whatever the next version of the api is so it can be designed sanely if we even ever want it."}, {'account_id': 1188, 'date': '2012-05-15 11:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Wishlist feature not approved.'}]

commit_message:
Implements user/tenant get_by_name API.

Fixes bug 972800, implementing missing API operations:

GET 'v2.0/users?name=string'
GET 'v2.0/tenants?name=string'

Change-Id: Ia0804dbf2e1b11c92d9b357fefaf2e9174d6b787

commit_message:
Fix Tenant.update() for enabled=False

Tenant.update() fails when attempting to set enabled=False due to how
the test to see if it was set in the arg list is formed.

Change-Id: Ibeea992c172cb9858d7201c9025f9715f98d3416

commit_message:
Expose deployer-specific properties in v2 API

* Validate deployer-specific image attributes in requests
* Don't validate data on serialization (yet)
* Partially implements bp api-v2-schemas

Change-Id: Ice5240f05cb8726423386657305381dbd6cfa6eb

commit_message:
Create an internal key pair API.

Creates an internal key pair API and update the EC2 and OS API's to
use it. This de-duplicates some of the code used to manage keypairs
across the APIs.

Fixes LP Bug #998059.

Change-Id: I10d58d7ce68cc2b993c72b6639f66c72def3bfbc

commit_message:
Change --user to --user_id and --role to --role_id in the keystone client for consistency.

Also changed an out-of-place tenant to tenant_id and removed unnecessary nargs in do_user_list.

Fixes bug 994744.

Change-Id: I418c07c8523f40822ca3251e85cd630ec877b45f

commit_message:
Flush tenant membership deletion before user

Ensure user tenant membership is *actually* removed before deleting
user.

Fixes bug 998137.  This should be proposed to stable/essex as well.

Change-Id: I097456e603177646d62ebf08ca71af1fd7f787bf

commit_message:
Invalidate user tokens when password is changed

Fixes bug 996595

This commit will cause all valid tokens to be deleted for a user
who's password is changed (implemented for the sql and kvs backends)

Change-Id: I6ad7da8957b7041983a3fc91d9ba9368667d06ac

commit_message:
rpc call/cast declares queue.

Fixes Bug 919835.

Made the exclusive as False while declaring the queue.

Creating an empty Queue in reconnect method of Publisher Class. This creates the queue for the topic
if doesn't exist in the rabbitmq list_queues. So that the messages are not dropped.

Changed the code to assign the values of self.kwargs to temporary variable.

Change-Id: Ie88b2345a3c5412cb12f60e7540fe627e0dcb826

subject: Expand recon middleware support
messages:
[{'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-02 09:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-02 10:17:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Here's a view of the new info that gets exposed via the middleware:

https://gist.github.com/2282353

While some of this stuff is handy to quickly get the state of a server without hitting the logs, I'm not sure how useful some of those stats are when queried via the cli (the swift-recon cli skips a few already). 

Should I just stick to having the cli only pull replication/auditor/updater times to keep things simple and not report stuff like replication error counts, or how many files the updater processed on the last path?"}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-05 22:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-10 19:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-10 19:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Updated to include offline feedback from dfg.'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2012-04-12 17:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

looks good, couple changes:

container_auditor / object_auditor dump_recon on existing log messaging

change number_none to something more descriptive

md5sums no "'"

change %d to %.3f for perc_none'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-04-25 16:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

bump to prevent expiry'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-27 17:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-27 17:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-27 17:22:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Had a bug in patch set5. Forgot to update swift-recon cli to account for changes to the auditor recon output.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-04-30 18:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2012-05-10 19:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

So, where does this change fit in the whole "move stuff to middleware/external projects" movement?'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-05-10 20:00:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

swift-recon's inclusion should be determined by the core committers.

Is swift-recon something that belongs in swift's core or is it something that the core devs want to include and officially support?"}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2012-05-10 20:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Do we vote?'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-05-10 23:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

My opinion: All the parts that dump information to /var/cache/swift seem necessary to reside in the core Swift repo. The rest seems optional, so whatever everybody else wants in that case I'm fine with.

I haven't yet fully reviewed this code otherwise though and, being kinda out of it (sick), I don't think I should right at the moment. :)"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-05-11 05:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I agree that it could work fine with the middleware extracted and the collection code remaining in core.  However, the amount of coupling between the two makes me nervous.

Changes in collection would need to be coordinated with another repo, resulting in extra effort to maintain compatibility between newer collection code and older recon middleware (or worse, introducing bugs due to a mismatch between the two).  It would be harder to unit test the combination of collection and exposure of it via the middleware.  It would be more effort to upgrade the middleware to keep up with core swift.  I.e. you could have to upgrade the recon middleware because you upgraded core swift simply because the two are coupled by a common storage "database".

If I had a vote, I'd vote for keeping the middleware code together with the collection code where they can be changed together, tested together, and upgraded together.  End users would know that whatever version of swift they have, its recon works without having to worry about which versions of swift work well with which versions of an external recon middleware.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-05-14 23:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-04-02 09:47:24.000000000', 'message': "Expand recon middleware support

Expand recon middleware to include support for account and container servers in
addition to the existing object servers. Also add support for retrieving recent
information from auditors, replicators, and updaters. In the case of certain
checks (such as container auditors) the stats returned are only for the most
recent path processed.

The middleware should now also handle errors better in cases where stats
are unavailable, and is clearer about logging errors when they are
encountered.

While new check's have been added the output from pre-existing check's
has not changed. This should allow existing 3rd party utilities such
as the Swift ZenPack to continue to function.

Change-Id: I801caaab3c8e544b168abc618ceda6b12c62bee0

commit_message:
Expand recon middleware support

Expand recon middleware to include support for account and container
servers in addition to the existing object servers. Also add support
for retrieving recent information from auditors, replicators, and
updaters. In the case of certain checks (such as container auditors)
the stats returned are only for the most recent path processed.

The middleware should now also handle errors better in cases where
stats are unavailable, and is clearer about logging errors when they
are encountered.

While new check's have been added the output from pre-existing
check's has not changed. This should allow existing 3rd party
utilities such as the Swift ZenPack to continue to function.

Change-Id: I801caaab3c8e544b168abc618ceda6b12c62bee0

commit_message:
Make import_nova_auth only create roles which don't already exist

Fixes bug #969088

If a role already exists, there's no particular need for import_nova_auth
to barf. Instead, we should just use the existing role.

Change-Id: I18ae38af62b4c2b2423e20e436611fc30f844ae1

[{'created': '2012-05-14 06:37:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove reference to QUANTUM_OVS_CONF_FILE before it is created.

This was introduced by commit 962c25eb7421094c6fc1ef7edb56fe1da69a972b,
but it completely breaks a clean install of devstack with OVS.

Note: the author was probably attempting to get devstack working in a
multi-node environment.  There is another branch under submission for
that already.

Change-Id: Ie2cbcbd58e0d0babf9b0af0db9aa879703a2aeb9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove reference to QUANTUM_OVS_CONF_FILE before it is created.

This was introduced by commit 962c25eb7421094c6fc1ef7edb56fe1da69a972b,
but it completely breaks a clean install of devstack with OVS.

Note: the author was probably attempting to get devstack working in a
multi-node environment.  There is another branch under submission for
that already.

Change-Id: Ie2cbcbd58e0d0babf9b0af0db9aa879703a2aeb9

commit_message:
Fix nova.tests.test_nova_rootwrap on Fedora 17.

Fix bug 992916

This patch resolves a unit test failure on Fedora 17.  The root cause is
that 'sleep' is '/usr/bin/sleep' instead of '/bin/sleep'.  Update the
test to allow that.

Change-Id: I5c8e04baec7159a8c10c9beb96cff58fd383e71c

commit_message:
Remove use of nova-manage project/user commands.

Remove nova-manage project/user commands so we are ready to
remove Nova deprecated auth.

commit_message:
Load schema properties when v2 API starts

* Read properties from etc/schema-image.json and etc/schema-access.json
* Gracefully handle the lack of custom schema property files
* Partially implements bp api-v2-schemas

Change-Id: Ida1a5afe48be9bce8a5d8faeeda9ed03848a4fd0

subject: Avoid setting up DHCP firewall rules with FlatManager
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2711, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'joshua.zhang@canonical.com', 'username': 'zhhuabj'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-04-14 19:12:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

A) please separate the lines in your commit message.

B) I don't like the idea of redefining filters with the same name based on a flag, it could lead to conflicts.  Since nova-vpn isn't used with flatmanager anyway i would recommend making a new filter called nova-nodhcp and setting it up along with nova-base and nova-vpn and then choosing it like so:

        if instance['image_ref'] == str(FLAGS.vpn_image_id):
            base_filter = 'nova-vpn'
        elif FLAGS.allow_dhcp:
            base_filter = 'nova-base'
        else:
            base_filter = 'nova-nodhcp'

C) as you can see above I don't like keying off network manager since the firewall handling is done on the compute node, so I would prefer a new flag to checking network manager.

D) You need to add yourself to the Authors file."}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-04-17 07:39:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-04-24 22:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for the cleanup.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-04-26 19:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-05-02 10:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-03 07:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-03 07:52:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-03 08:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-05-03 08:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-04 11:04:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't see why we need another flag for this. We know whether the network manager requires DHCP or not.

As I said in bug #704737:

  In setup_basic_filtering(), do:

   allow_dhcp = 'dhcp_server' in network_info

  and pass that to ensure_static_filters() and only add the
  allow-dhcp-server rule if that's true

Happy to explain further if needed"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-04 18:57:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Mark: I suggested the new flag because I didn't want to key off of a flag which could easily be set differntly on the network host.  I like your solution of keying off of the network_info data though."}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-07 10:47:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

hi Mark, dhcp_server will always in network_info no matter it's FlatManager or FlatDhcpManager.

because after invoking method get_instance_nw_info, nova will continue to invoke method legacy_network_info (in $nova/compute/utils.py ) to convert network_info.

method legacy_network_info has following line, it use gateway as default dhcp_server if can't get dchp_server from meta:

 dhcp_server = get_meta(subnet_v4, 'dhcp_server', gateway)

so I think it's suitable to add a new flag, what do you think that ?"}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-07 11:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Mark, because dhcp_server will always in network_info, and 
if we also don't want to add a new flag, if we can consider to use one existing flag "flat_injected" ?
if flat_injected=true, dhcp will because no sense, thus dhcp_filter also should not be applied in NetworkManager.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-05-07 11:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: No score

This is a sample of network_info variable:
[({
    'bridge': u '7e32a6c6-c9b4-4ef0-8f30-472ea02dcdec',
    'multi_host': False,
    'bridge_interface': None,
    'cidr_v6': None,
    'vlan': None,
    'injected': True,
    'cidr': u '10.10.10.0/24',
    'id': u '7e32a6c6-c9b4-4ef0-8f30-472ea02dcdec'
}, {
    'rxtx_cap': 0,
    'should_create_bridge': False,
    'dns': [u '8.8.4.4'],
    'ip6s': [],
    'label': u 'public',
    'broadcast': '10.10.10.255',
    'ips': [{
        'ip': u '10.10.10.6',
        'netmask': '255.255.255.0',
        'enabled': '1',
        'gateway': u '10.10.10.1'
    }],
    'mac': u 'fa:16:3e:39:4e:27',
    'vif_uuid': u '8bdd79d1-9f4e-430b-89af-e0a153534c0c',
    'should_create_vlan': False,
    'gateway_v6': None,
    'dhcp_server': u '10.10.10.1',
    'gateway': u '10.10.10.1'
})]
please see "injected" key.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-08 10:00:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Vish - my suggestion is to use the info passed from network to compute to do this. You shouldn't need to set *any* config option on the compute node for this - i.e. I don't see a great difference between using dhcp_filter or network_manager for this :)

zhhuabj - your point on dhcp_server is a good one, but we can fix that.

If you make this change:

 - dhcp_server = get_meta(subnet_v4, 'dhcp_server', gateway)
 + dhcp_server = get_meta(subnet_v4, 'dhcp_server')

you'll get the behaviour we want. This should work because _get_dhcp_ip() in network manager already sets dhcp_server to the gateway, but it only does it if DHCP is set to True"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-08 10:00:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Ah, sorry Vish - I didn't see your "I like your solution" comment the first time around :)'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-08 18:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Mark: +1 I think it is reasonably to only set dhcp_server in network info if it is needed.  Then your solution works perfectly.'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-09 06:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-09 14:27:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks like good progress, but Smokestack shows the unit tests failing

Also, the commit message needs work e.g.

  Avoid setting up DHCP firewall rules with FlatManager

  Fixes bug #704737

  With FlatManager, ensure that the network info's 
  dhcp_server value is not set and use that key to decide 
  in the compute service whether DHCP firewall rules should
  be added."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-09 14:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-11 14:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-05-11 16:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Seems ok to me'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-11 19:45:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Minor change inline.  If there is some reason why None won't work, let me know. Also not sure if all of Marks comments were addressed.

Otherwise it is looking good to me."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-11 21:29:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (2 inline comments)

Agree with Vish's comment on None vs ''

But the 'nova-nodhcp' thing is my bigger concern"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-11 21:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Retracting the nova-nodhcp comment, only the Nona vs '' issue remains for me"}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-12 15:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

hi Vish and Mark, there is some reason for None vs '' issue.

if I use None, the following code will throw error in method format_dom of $nova/nova/virt/libvirt/config.py:
for p in self.filterparams:
     filter.append(etree.Element("parameter",
            name=p['key'],
            value=p['value']))
because for etree.Element, value must not be None.

in $nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py, there are some filter params (IP, DHCPSERVER, RASERVER, PROJNET, PROJMASK, PROJNET, PROJMASK6)
Note: those filter params are orderly. 
conf.add_filter_param("IP", mapping['ips'][0]['ip'])
conf.add_filter_param("DHCPSERVER", mapping['dhcp_server'])
conf.add_filter_param("RASERVER", mapping.get('gateway_v6') + "/128")
conf.add_filter_param("PROJNET", net)
conf.add_filter_param("PROJMASK", mask)
conf.add_filter_param("PROJNET6", net_v6)
conf.add_filter_param("PROJMASK6", prefixlen_v6)

in order to aviod above issue, I will have to edit one line  
from 
      conf.add_filter_param("DHCPSERVER", mapping['dhcp_server'])
to 
      if mapping['dhcp_server']:
	  conf.add_filter_param("DHCPSERVER", mapping['dhcp_server'])

if we do so, it will less one filter param, so it will throw following error from one line " self.assertEquals(parameters[1].get('name'), 'DHCPSERVER')" in method test_multi_nic in $nova/nova/tests/test_libvirt.py
FAIL: test_xml_and_uri_rescue (nova.tests.test_libvirt.LibvirtConnTestCase)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/bak/openstack/nova/nova/tests/test_libvirt.py", line 608, in test_xml_and_uri_rescue
    expect_ramdisk=True, rescue=True)
  File "/bak/openstack/nova/nova/tests/test_libvirt.py", line 1138, in _check_xml_and_uri
    (check(tree), expected_result, i))
AssertionError: RASERVER != DHCPSERVER failed common check 3

so I think it's better to use '' than None, what do you think that ? thanks.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-13 09:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Yes, this looks fine:

 if mapping['dhcp_server']:
     conf.add_filter_param("DHCPSERVER", mapping['dhcp_server'])

As for the tests, you know that fake_get_instance_nw_info() is using FlatManager so you can just delete the DHCPSERVER check'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-05-14 09:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-14 12:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-14 18:07:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I'm ok with that explanation.  Thanks.

Vish"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-14 18:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/4088/ : SUCCESS

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/2499/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/3895/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-05-14 18:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Avoid setting up DHCP firewall rules with FlatManager

Fixes bug #704737

With FlatManager, ensure that the network info's dhcp_server value is not set
and use that key to decide in the compute service whether DHCP firewall rules should be added.

Change-Id: I8183a6fa3881adea1a09f3f1a29442e6b7a919ce

commit_message:
Make allocation failure a bit more friendly

If the user allocates the wrong address display
a message about incorrect address rather than a traceback.

Fixes LP: #957707

Change-Id: I8ccd3056f755afb9f873a25fd494428e481ff3a2
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Report memory correctly on Xen. Fixes bug 997014

/proc/meminfo may show wrong values for the memory when using Xen, so
this fix computes the memory quering libivrt.

Change-Id: I188e2d34bcee13954653b93b9b816cf4530b8859

This is great, I didn't have the chance to test the code since I don't have a Statd infrastructure running but the code look great.

It would be nice to add some sample documentation (or via a blog post later) for the external middle-ware authors explaining how they can plug into the statd system."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-05-14 09:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-05-14 16:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Chmouel,
I'll definitely be fleshing out the "how to actually use this stuff" soon(ish).  First up will be a blog entry on how to integrate these metrics with Ganglia (amusingly enough, considering we use Graphite in-house) using our fork of the pystatsd project (watch out, there's two "pystatsd" kind of projects in github--this is the one with a server component).

I also plan to clean up the proxy metrics so they can fully replace Informant (right now, the integrated metrics don't slice by response code, which is probably worth the extra I/O and storage to track separately).  That would be a good time to document the internal API for sending out metrics (to be consumed by Swift developers).  Where should that kind of documentation go?  (Obviously, I initially focused on the documentation aimed at deployers of swift.)

Also, always feel free to unicast me at darrell@swiftstack.com with questions/suggestions (like developer documentation, for example).

Thanks!
Darrell'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-05-14 16:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-04-01 23:48:22.000000000', 'message': 'Adding StatsD logging to Swift.

Documentation, including a list of metrics reported and their semantics,
are in the Admin Guide in a new section, "Reporting Metrics to StatsD".

Here is the rationale for doing a deep integration like this versus only
sending metrics to StatsD in middleware.  It's the only way to report
some internal activities of Swift in a real-time manner. So to have one
way of reporting to StatsD and one place/style of configuration, even
some things (like, say, timing of PUT requests into the proxy-server)
which could be logged via middleware are consistently logged the same
way (deep integration via the logger delegate methods).

When log_statsd_host is configured and the pystatsd module is installed,
get_logger() injects a pystatsd.Client object into the logger as
logger.statsd_client.  Then a set of delegate methods on LogAdapter
either pass through to the pystatsd.Client object or become no-ops. This
allows StatsD logging to look like:
    self.logger.increment('some.metric.here')
and do the right thing in all cases and with no messy conditional logic.

Refactored out _one_audit_pass() method in swift/account/auditor.py and
swift/container/auditor.py.

Fixed some misc. PEP8 violations.

Change-Id: Ie968a9ae8771f59ee7591e2ae11999c44bfe33b2
'}, {'created': '2012-04-04 00:18:11.000000000', 'message': 'Adding StatsD logging to Swift.

Documentation, including a list of metrics reported and their semantics,
is in the Admin Guide in a new section, "Reporting Metrics to StatsD".

Here is the rationale for doing a deep integration like this versus only
sending metrics to StatsD in middleware.  It's the only way to report
some internal activities of Swift in a real-time manner. So to have one
way of reporting to StatsD and one place/style of configuration, even
some things (like, say, timing of PUT requests into the proxy-server)
which could be logged via middleware are consistently logged the same
way (deep integration via the logger delegate methods).

When log_statsd_host is configured, get_logger() injects a
swift.common.utils.StatsdClient object into the logger as
logger.statsd_client.  Then a set of delegate methods on LogAdapter
either pass through to the StatsdClient object or become no-ops. This
allows StatsD logging to look like:
    self.logger.increment('some.metric.here')
and do the right thing in all cases and with no messy conditional logic.

I wanted to use the pystatsd module for the StatsD client, but the
version on PyPi is lagging the git repo (and is missing both the prefix
functionality and timing_since() method).  So I wrote my
swift.common.utils.StatsdClient.  The interface is the same as
pystatsd.Client, but the code was written from scratch.  It's pretty
simple, and the tests I added cover it.  This also frees Swift from an
optional dependency on the pystatsd module, making this feature easier
to enable.

There's test coverage for the new code and all existing tests continue
to pass.

Refactored out _one_audit_pass() method in swift/account/auditor.py and
swift/container/auditor.py.

Fixed some misc. PEP8 violations.

Change-Id: Ie968a9ae8771f59ee7591e2ae11999c44bfe33b2

commit_message:
Adding StatsD logging to Swift.

Documentation, including a list of metrics reported and their semantics,
is in the Admin Guide in a new section, "Reporting Metrics to StatsD".
An optional "metric prefix" may be configured which will be prepended to
every metric name sent to StatsD.

Here is the rationale for doing a deep integration like this versus only
sending metrics to StatsD in middleware.  It's the only way to report
some internal activities of Swift in a real-time manner. So to have one
way of reporting to StatsD and one place/style of configuration, even
some things (like, say, timing of PUT requests into the proxy-server)
which could be logged via middleware are consistently logged the same
way (deep integration via the logger delegate methods).

When log_statsd_host is configured, get_logger() injects a
swift.common.utils.StatsdClient object into the logger as
logger.statsd_client.  Then a set of delegate methods on LogAdapter
either pass through to the StatsdClient object or become no-ops. This
allows StatsD logging to look like:
    self.logger.increment('some.metric.here')
and do the right thing in all cases and with no messy conditional logic.

I wanted to use the pystatsd module for the StatsD client, but the
version on PyPi is lagging the git repo (and is missing both the prefix
functionality and timing_since() method).  So I wrote my
swift.common.utils.StatsdClient.  The interface is the same as
pystatsd.Client, but the code was written from scratch.  It's pretty
simple, and the tests I added cover it.  This also frees Swift from an
optional dependency on the pystatsd module, making this feature easier
to enable.

There's test coverage for the new code and all existing tests continue
to pass.

Refactored out _one_audit_pass() method in swift/account/auditor.py and
swift/container/auditor.py.

Fixed some misc. PEP8 violations.

Misc test cleanups and refactorings (particularly the way "fake logging"
is handled).

Change-Id: Ie968a9ae8771f59ee7591e2ae11999c44bfe33b2

commit_message:
Updates VLAN documentation.

Brings the VLAN section up to date with essex, and documents how to
install the VLAN kernel module on the host.

Minor semantic tag adding and copy-editing in other sections.

Fixes bug 992846.
Fixes bug 752738.

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/7337

Change-Id: I6b935d346b9c83e13667383282fab903733e7e1c

commit_message:
Support custom properties in schemas for v2 API

* Add glance schema API (glance.schema:API)
* Disallow custom properties that conflict with base properties
* Implements bp api-v2-schemas

Change-Id: Ibfa617cb5edf16627627debc30149669213d4b2d

Fixes bug #998396

Both Nova and Keystone need to clear the overrides on their config

commit_message:
cfg: make reset() clear defaults and overrides

Fixes bug #998396

Both Nova and Keystone need to clear the overrides on their config
object between test runs. It's reasonable to expect the reset()
method would do this, so let's make it so.

Also add a clear() method with the old behaviour.

Change-Id: I192c5bb07e81f0fb844fa2fd429dc2e7133800de

commit_message:
Tests to cover various mailmap formats.

Bug: 994957

Mailmap might include entries in different format:
   Full Name <email@foo.com> Full Name <email@bar.com>
   Firstname <email@foo.com> Firstname <email@bar.com>
   <email@foo.com> <email@bar.com>

This commit adds a test case to parse these entries.

* tests/unit/test_setup.py
  Remove unused imports.
  Import os and setup methods to verify.

  SetupTest: Define unique test case name.
  setUp(): New method to define temporary mailmap file.
  tearDown(): New method to remove the temporary mailmap file.
  test_mailmap_with_fullname(): New method to test mailmap entry
  with fullname.
  test_mailmap_with_firstname(): New method to test mailmap entry
  with first name only.
  test_mailmap_with_noname(): New method to test mailmap entry with
  just email addresses.

Change-Id: Icc018d4b2692ce7a7de757f02d1dd49241c30a6c

commit_message:
Updates VLAN documentation.

Brings the VLAN section up to date with essex, and documents how to
install the VLAN kernel module on the host.

Minor semantic tag adding and copy-editing in other sections.

Fixes bug 992846.
Fixes bug 752738.

Change-Id: I6b935d346b9c83e13667383282fab903733e7e1c

commit_message:
Fix libvirt Connection.get_disks method

The get_disks() method is not used anywhere yet, and is not tested properly,
but it does not work as reported in bug #998089.

This patch add unit test for it and fixes it so it's now possible to
retrieve the list of device name associated with a libvirt domain.

Change-Id: If09fb683364174fe02cbcbec4c6bbcda991287d6
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Removed ambiguity about when to sync the nova db.

The documentation as written was ambiguous about whether the nova-manage
sync_db command should be run after the database is created. Reworded to
try to make this less ambiguity.

Also removed some text about setting up the database, since the database
setup has already been described in the preceding section.

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/7250

Change-Id: I8a23c0118965cfaa6141d1230a890777770d86ff

commit_message:
Fixed secgroup-add-rule

secgroup-add-rule was being done to "default" group when it should have been
done to "openpub" group.

Other changes:
 * Mac OS -> Mac OS X
 * Added a <link> to trystack.org
 * Random line wrap changes due to editing with Oxygen

 Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/7317

Change-Id: I4138b7799eff62a1df24b1155c9d496c35a141a0

overall, looks good.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-05-12 18:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Thanks again Gary for doing this. I have performed some basic tests with the Linux Bridge plugin (installation using devstack and also from source), and also ran the agent tests. Things seem to be working fine.

I did run into a problem with creating VMs on the default network created after devstack installation. I am not sure if this was due to a residual configuration on my machine. However, I would not want to hold up this patch due to this issue (since in most likelyhood its not related to the changes here).

Given that Dan has done a +2 and has verified the ovs agent changes, I am going ahead and merging this.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-05-12 18:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-12 18:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

A good start.   A few minor nits inline.

Please ensure that config data, just like web data, is marshalled/validated at the edges rather than internally to the application.

What happens if the plugin never manages to register the models?  Is it desirable that connections are continually attempted no matter what, or should there a limit on the number of reconnections?  Or the absolute amount of time to attempt reconnection?"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-12 18:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

subject: Fix Modified Error message when AMQP Server is unreachable
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-04-09 14:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you update your commit message so the top line is a 50-char or less summary of the whole fix?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-04-09 15:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does this fix an error?  If so a bug report would be great.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-04-09 17:59:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

I don't understand the point here.  The code will already catch a failure if rabbit is not running or the server is not reachable.  Also, in this patch, there's a small window between checking w/ telnet and connecting w/ kombu where the server could die or be killed anyway.  Might as well just leave it to error on kombu connect.  Also, I find using telnetlib in general to be rather ugly.  If this were absolutely needed in some way, using socket calls directly would be preferred."}, {'account_id': 2970, 'date': '2012-04-11 06:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-04-25 17:50:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Still don't agree with this patch, since we already catch connection failures and retry.  And using telnetlib, etc is really, really kludgy anyway."}, {'account_id': 2970, 'date': '2012-04-26 08:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-04-27 08:49:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Why try to connect to rabbit's port at all before letting kombu try to connect?  You're just duplicating work that kombu already does.  We catch the failures already and reconnect.

What case are you trying to solve that is not already covered?"}, {'account_id': 2970, 'date': '2012-04-27 09:37:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

With the previous code,
When the AMQP server is not reachable either due to unavailability of the server or invalid credentials the error message is 'AMQP Server is unreachable'.

So I considered two scenarios which will display the error message accordingly,

1. To Ping the AMQP Server and display the error message which indicates the server is not available and then check the credentials.
2. If credentials are invalid then an error message is displayed in the logger.

To differentiate the above two scenarios,I wrote small piece of code to ping the AMQP server with an exception class to display the error message."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-04-27 15:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not submit

(1 inline comment)

I tend to agree w/ Chris here. This seems overly complex.

Perhaps the right way to resolve this ticket is to just update the error message (which you commented out).

Also. As is this branch hangs when running unit tests on the RpcKombuTestCase:test_declare_consumer_errors_will_reconnect.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-12 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-05-12 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}]

When AMQP Server is Unreachable display error message.

commit_message:
Fix Modified Error message when AMQP Server is unreachable

To PING the AMQP Server using socket calls.
When AMQP Server is Unreachable display error message.
If PING is success,login to the Server.
If the credentials are invalid then display error message.

Fixes bug 918238

Change-Id: I6392b5f6382580062103d5b3ee45979bb030f221

commit_message:
Add support for quota-headroom

Fixes bug 967264

The new quota-headroom verb displays both the quota threshold
and the remaining headroom for each resource type, e.g.:

 $> nova quota-headroom $TENANT_ID
 +-----------------------------+-----------+----------+
 |            Quota            | Threshold | Headroom |
 +-----------------------------+-----------+----------+
 | cores                       | 20        | 18       |
 | floating_ips                | 10        | 9        |
 | gigabytes                   | 1000      | 1000     |
 | injected_file_content_bytes | 10240     | None     |
 | injected_files              | 5         | None     |
 | instances                   | 10        | 9        |
 | metadata_items              | 128       | None     |
 | ram                         | 51200     | 50688    |
 | volumes                     | 10        | 10       |
 +-----------------------------+-----------+----------+

The output formating of the pre-existing quota-* verbs is
also improved to include meaningful column headers.

This patch depends on the core nova patch proposed here:

  https://review.openstack.org/5910

Change-Id: I7f920aa672b88cc6bc41bff27f575ff9089709a2

Update section "Deployment Tool for OpenStack using Puppet".

subject: Update KillFilter to handle 'deleted' exe's.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-04-27 13:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Looks like a pretty serious issue since something like a simple package update could cause stuff to mysteriously stop working.

The fix has been merged into master already it looks like python's rstrip() is a bit broken:

  >>> "foobar (deleted)".rstrip(" (deleted)")
  'foobar'
  >>> "deleted (deleted)".rstrip(" (deleted)")
  ''
  >>> "foobardeleted (deleted)".rstrip(" (deleted)")
  'foobar''}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-04-27 13:33:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, it's not rstrip() which is broken ... it does in fact take a set of characters:

  >>> 'commandddddd (deleted)'.rstrip(' (deleted)')
  'comman'"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-04-27 14:45:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The correct fix for this is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/6865/

test case included."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-04 10:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-04 10:16:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Update KillFilter to handle 'deleted' exe's.

Updates KillFilter so that it handles the case where the executable
linked to by /proc/PID/exe is updated or deleted.

Fixes LP Bug #967931.

Also added a unit test to test that 'deleted' exe's are
filtered correctly.

(cherry picked from commit b24c11b and commit 3d28e3d)

Change-Id: I368a01383bf62b64b7579d573b8b84640dec03ae

commit_message:
Fix bug 983206 : _try_convert parsing string

* _try_convert in ec2utils.py didn't handle strings starting with "0x"
* Added tests to cover bug
* Add better float support
* remove unused complex number support

Change-Id: I382d36f4a8671bcceccfa1ebdbae89a9d2aca207
(cherry picked from commit c95162e52899618fc269fb536f6a2d3b26b7794d)

commit_message:
QuantumManager will start dnsmasq during startup. Fixes bug 977759

Added _setup_network_on_host method, which calls update_dhcp
if quantum_use_dhcp is set.

Change-Id: I193212037873001a03da7b7a484f61a5c13b5de8

[{'created': '2012-05-04 21:07:37.000000000', 'message': "Create a utf8 version of the dns_domains table.

charset and has its primary key length set to 512.

table and seems to cause a slew of errors like:

1) Dumping a database with mysqldump and trying to import it fails
because this table is latin1 but fkeys to utf8 tables (projects).

2) Trying to alter the old dns_domains table fails with errors
like:
 mysql> ALTER TABLE dns_domains DROP PRIMARY KEY;
 ERROR 1025 (HY000): Error on rename of './nova/#sql-6cf_855'....

This patch creates a new migration that re-creates the dns_domains
table with a shorter 'domain' column which works with the utf8
charset.

Fixes LP Bug #993663.

commit_message:
Create a utf8 version of the dns_domains table.

The old dns_domains table was encoded in the 'latin1'
charset and has its primary key length set to 512.
This is too long to be a valid pkey in a proper 'utf8' encoded
table and seems to cause a slew of errors like:

1) Dumping a database with mysqldump and trying to import it fails
because this table is latin1 but fkeys to utf8 tables (projects).

2) Trying to alter the old dns_domains table fails with errors
like:
 mysql> ALTER TABLE dns_domains DROP PRIMARY KEY;
 ERROR 1025 (HY000): Error on rename of './nova/#sql-6cf_855'....

This patch creates a new migration that re-creates the dns_domains
table with a shorter 'domain' column which works with the utf8
charset.

Fixes LP Bug #993663.

Change-Id: I2060d39cbdabd20f410ebd501160a04c51641755

[{'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2012-05-09 06:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have had some doubts about this patch. It introduces a new flag, but behavior is not changed at all for existing deployments.'}, {'account_id': 2883, 'date': '2012-05-09 07:46:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ghe,

That is correct. We didn't want to disturb existing deployments. Additional flag can be used as an override for the corner case described in the defect."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-05-09 14:03:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Please forgive me if I am missing something, but the base_dir_name seems like the tip of the iceberg. I don't see how the whole cache cleanup code is supposed to work if it is run on multiple compute nodes at the same time all groveling over the same nfs mount. This code walks the instance names which may come and go as different nodes create/kill vms.

It seems like the whole instances directory needs to be per-compute-node for this to work. You would lose image sharing but you do with this change also. There is some code that aggregates local disk totals that is now relying on
there being a single instances dir but I am not sure what "local" really means with shared instance storage.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-09 16:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The individual instances directories are uniquely named across the system.  The only potential issue could be during a migration, although I think the live migration code handles the case.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-09 17:51:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

Minor nits, inline."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-09 21:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-09 21:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This looks more like a new feature to me

i.e. if a shared instances path doesn't work in essex at the moment, that sounds like it just wasn't a supported configuration? Did this ever work in the past?

If it didn't work in the past, this looks like a very risky fix to add a new feature - the opposite of out "safe fixes for high impact user visible bugs" policy

Thoughts? Vish?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-09 22:07:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

backing instances to shared folders did work at some point, and in fact they do work in essex aside from the race condition mentioned in the bug.'}, {'account_id': 2883, 'date': '2012-05-10 09:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maru,

I have made code changes to address your comments in master (As suggested by Mark that such changes should first go to master) : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7297/1 

Please review.

Once those changes are merged in master, they can be back ported to stable/essex'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-10 12:44:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, based on Vish's comment that this use case is expected to work in Essex, I'm happy for it to go in

It's a significant issue with that use case and, while the fix touches a lot of places, it looks fairly safe.

commit_message:
Introduced flag base_dir_name. Fixes bug 973194

rebased from master.

If user faces locking related problem when two nova-compute hosts
sharing same disk area via nfs, try to download same image into
cache concurrently - Then base_dir_name can be set to "_base_$my_ip" in
nova.conf

Default value for base_dir_name is "_base" thus retaining existing
behavior.

Change-Id: Icff10ed75ba83f7256731614dc9e01e578b347a4

I agree that this should happen, but should the check be in the OSAPI or be part of nova.compute.api:API.snapshot(...)? 

Basically, it seems like we could get the same funcionality by calling _check_metadata_properties_quota in _create_image in the compute API and avoid duplicating the logic of checking > 255 key length.

Then, the OSAPI would catch QuotaError and raise HTTP 400s."}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-04-03 04:17:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Added img metadata validation. Fixes bug 962117.

1. Added validation for image metadata.
2. Renamed the method 'check_img_metadata_quota_limit' to
'check_img_metadata_quota_limit' since it also validates the image metadata.
3. Added unit test cases.

Change-Id: I0e9dad97c03070363d14977897701e146870e41a

commit_message:
Use default qemu-img cluster size in libvirt connection driver

The recommended cluster size [1] for qcow2 is 64k, which is the default
when invoking 'qemu-img create ...'.  Remove the cluster_size option
from qemu-img invocation.

[1] http://www.mail-archive.com/openstack@lists.launchpad.net/msg11371.html

V2: Fix test.

Change-Id: Iafc290720a820cb5f57ded10a2f584fdc5cd5b49

* add {create|delete|set} tenant commands

commit_message:
Add API versioning support

* Specific versions supported are managed in XXXXXX.client.py with a
  mapping from version to client class.  This is based on the scheme
  that is included in novaclient; none of the other client libs have
  that capability.

Change-Id: I930b197f1189e7f52c3b0096e73e0773cf925542

commit_message:
Destroy system metadata when destroying instance

instance system_metadata was not being marked as deleted when an
instance is marked as deleted.

Fixes bug 997849

Change-Id: I876b402ca33f4574bb426615f6c467ded6908fc2

These new APIs aren't actually used anywhere in the codebase, they're being added to support future novaplugins work. We shouldn't be adding unused code to Nova

This is a great example of work something that should be on a feature branch on github: https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg11355.html

i.e. create a fork on github, push your patch to a novaplugins branch and continue the plugins work in subsequent patches there. Add details of the branch to the blueprint. commit_message:
Support adding and removing drivers at runtime.

The plugin framework is going to want to instantiate
notifiers, set them up, and then add them to the
notification chain.

For blueprint novaplugins.

Change-Id: I4e0dfd0560ca39deedb1affe91ef00c82ba81439

commit_message:
Remove instance Foreign Key in volumes table, replace with instance_uuid

* Remove the instance relationship and instance_id FK
* Add instance_uuuid column to volumes table

Change-Id: I54d723dcb9819731a58ec64095c54c99aa9e5dc4

And even further up the  console output I see the python-keystoneclient package doesn't have a stable/essex branch.   

Since other commits to nova stable/essex are failing at the same place (https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/nova+branch:stable/essex,n,z, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7298/)  It  looks like devstack for nova stable/essex is broken."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-05-11 17:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Get unit tests functional in OS X

* Add detection for directio to ensure the python runtime is built with O_DIRECT
* Extend stubbing in test_libvirt to also stub out _supports_direct_io

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-11 17:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'Handle hpcloud assigning ips by default.

HPCloud now includes a public ip on every server, but still _also_
has the floating ip extension.  Try to identify the public ip
(by guessing!) and stop using floating ips if possible.

Change-Id: I7c089b94b64cf6ebc168d44b55f43bd07ca12563
'}]
commit_message:
Handle hpcloud assigning ips by default.

HPCloud now includes a public ip on every server, but still _also_
has the floating ip extension.  Try to identify the public ip
(by guessing!) and stop using floating ips if possible.

Change-Id: I7c089b94b64cf6ebc168d44b55f43bd07ca12563

commit_message:
Add resources for floating_ip, keypair, volume. Add floating_ip test.

Provide mechanism to pre-allocate vms, floating_ips, keypairs and volumes.
Abstract time-related functions to PendingAction and move server-specific
  stuff to PendingServerAction subclass.
Rename State to ClusterState.
Add test that associates/disassociates floating_ips and servers.

Change-Id: I1651c38cc75d755bde370fb6a49ff4231e96255e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-05-11 00:13:32.000000000', 'message': "Store image properties with instance system_metadata

In implementing adding 'image_meta' to instance notifications,
this was committed:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7309
commit 53adfd289bf7226f1c6f59c17608e42f3083f130

However, it's buggy because an instance could have been deleted after we
built from it... and bin/instance-usage-audit uses an admin context with
which we cannot query glance.

This stores image properties with instances in nova as system_metadata
and notifications will use that data.

Fixes bug 997833

Change-Id: I50575969b5cb28adaae9a713e749dc486772c417

which we cannot query glance.

and notifications will use that data.

Change-Id: I50575969b5cb28adaae9a713e749dc486772c417

commit_message:
Store image properties with instance system_metadata

In implementing adding 'image_meta' to instance notifications,
this was committed:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7309
commit 53adfd289bf7226f1c6f59c17608e42f3083f130

However, it's buggy because an instance could have been deleted after we
built from it... and bin/instance-usage-audit uses an admin context with
which we cannot query glance.

This stores image properties with instances in nova as system_metadata
and notifications will use that data.

Fixes bug 997833

Change-Id: I50575969b5cb28adaae9a713e749dc486772c417

commit_message:
Actually use xenapi fake setter

It was implemented (with a small bug), but never used. Also, lean on
the xenapi fake over using stubs in the migration tests to ensure we
test more code.

Change-Id: I96a7222a017302332bd6a3600fa645a74c502944

[{'created': '2012-04-30 06:31:27.000000000', 'message': 'Let some swift-ring-builder commands take >1 arg.

`swift-ring-builder X.builder [add|set_weight|set_info|remove]` can
now work on multiple devices at once.

This allows for faster bulk operations; for example, if an
administrator has to add 48 new devices to the ring, then this lets
them do it in one command invocation. Since each invocation of
swift-ring-builder follows a deserialize-operate-serialize pattern,
using the bulk form of the commands on N devices will save N-1
[de]serializations.

Change-Id: Ibf77528f28026866af3c94d0370181c8013d5bc5
'}, {'created': '2012-05-04 00:45:34.000000000', 'message': 'Let some swift-ring-builder commands take >1 arg.

`swift-ring-builder X.builder [add|set_weight|set_info|remove]` can
now work on multiple devices at once.

This allows for faster bulk operations; for example, if an
administrator has to add 48 new devices to the ring, then this lets
them do it in one command invocation. Since each invocation of
swift-ring-builder follows a deserialize-operate-serialize pattern,
using the bulk form of the commands on N devices will save N-1
[de]serializations.

Change-Id: Ibf77528f28026866af3c94d0370181c8013d5bc5
'}]
commit_message:
Let some swift-ring-builder commands take >1 arg.

`swift-ring-builder X.builder [add|set_weight|set_info|remove]` can
now work on multiple devices at once.

This allows for faster bulk operations; for example, if an
administrator has to add 48 new devices to the ring, then this lets
them do it in one command invocation. Since each invocation of
swift-ring-builder follows a deserialize-operate-serialize pattern,
using the bulk form of the commands on N devices will save N-1
[de]serializations.

Change-Id: Ibf77528f28026866af3c94d0370181c8013d5bc5

commit_message:
cleanup dependent data upon user/tenant deletion

fixes bug 974199
fixes bug 973243

* upon deletion of tenant also delete user tenant relations
* upon deletion of tenant or user also delete corresponding metadata
* add foreign keys in metadata to ensure consistency

see also: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/959294/comments/16

Change-Id: I264714fe82b727e3e0f5273bcb781a580a3f3826

commit_message:
Remove instance Foreign Key in volumes table, replace with instance_uuid

* Remove the instance relationship and instance_id FK
* Add instance_uuuid column to volumes table
* Passed unit tests and devstack tests

Change-Id: Id598f1f1d7915d1af6bf3dd75e5819dce08aaa0f

subject: Remove unnecessary glance-api-noauth pipeline
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-07 15:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-07 15:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I greatly prefer spelling out exactly what the auth information is rather than compressing it into the fake X-Auth-Token header. I want the fakeauth pipeline to go away in favor of noauth.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-07 19:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hmmm ... it sounds like noauth is being set up to do pretty much what fakeauth was doing, but in a more direct way (i.e. by setting all the required headers in the client).

The reasons why I thought fakeauth was a better approach:

1. The name is far more logical IMO, as noauth connotes the /lack/ of auth, as opposed to auth being faked by the expected headers being set in advance.

2. It encodes this set of headers (X-Identity-Status, X-Role) just once in the fakeauth middleware, as opposed to mutiple times in potentially many test clients.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-07 19:13:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, I am intending noauth to do something equivalent. I do agree that 'fakeauth' is a better name for it. However, I do not agree that compressing the five headers we have into one is good practice. I feel like it's adding a layer of misdirection for those that might be reading our tests and trying to interpret the expected behavior. Being explicit in tests is extremely valuable."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-09 12:34:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Brian,

There is one case where the noauth approach falls down - that occurs when the credentials need to be propagated from glance-api to glance-registry. 

In the noauth case, the required headers would not be passed on via the registry client (i.e. the test only explicitly controls the headers set on the client->api leg, but not the onward api->registry leg).

That fact that only the X-Auth-Token header is propagated is why I choose to shoe-horn all the fake auth info into this single header.

So in order to use noauth across the board, I think we'd have to arrange for all the auth-related headers to be propagated, which would be a much more disruptive change than simply using fakeauth everywhere.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-05-09 14:10:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I understand the rationale behind doing it, and I would like to point out that the eventual goal is to get rid of the glance-registry abstraction altogether. I would really prefer to use the explicit approach where we can and use the combined auth token where necessary (until it can be removed). What do you think? I can fix the naming so both approaches are clearly denoted.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-10 15:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Fair enough, lets continue with both until the fakeauth approach is no longer required.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-11 14:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Continuing with both fakeauth and noauth until the former is no longer required.'}]

subject: Fixes bug 997565.
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-10 14:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for working on this!  I have a couple of suggestions in-line…'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-10 14:28:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The modified docstring doesn't clearly capture the fact that at least one of disk_format and container_format must always be set. So in a sense, these fields are somewhat between 'Required' and 'Optional' (and closer to the former).

One way of describing this would be continue to mark the fields as 'Required' but to also indicate that this requirement may be met by defaulting to the other field's value, *if* that happens to be set to an Amazon format (ami, aki or ari). 

Also, the related docco in glance/doc/source/glance.rst should be updated appropriately in the same patch.

Thanks,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-05-11 08:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-05-11 13:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-05-11 14:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved
